Nobody is immune to pain and suffering. Life is filled with pains and challenges, and they make us

instruction:
Why is it that only proteins, carbohydrates and fats are deemed to have caloric value?
Just to clarify - consider the hypothetical situation below:
100g of 'carbohydrates' = 400kCal
100g of 'protein' = 400kCal
100g of 'fat' = 900kCal
100g of 'vitamins, minerals and/or other electrolytes' = ?
output_1: The caloric value of vitamins, minerals and/or other electrolytes is unknown because these nutrients are not sources of energy in the same way that proteins, carbohydrates, and fats are. Proteins, carbohydrates, and fats are macronutrients that provide the body with energy and are the only nutrients that contain calories. Vitamins, minerals, and other electrolytes are micronutrients that are essential for many bodily functions, but do not provide the body with energy.
output_2:
Why is it that only proteins, carbohydrates and fats are deemed to have caloric value?
Just to clarify - consider the hypothetical situation below:
100g of 'carbohydrates' = 400kCal
100g of 'protein' = 400kCal
100g of 'fat' = 900kCal
100g of 'vitamins, minerals and/or other electrolytes' = ??
But - why should non-caloric materials like vitamins, minerals or electrolytes not have caloric value?
They are not energy-releasing compounds like 'proteins', 'carbohydrates' or 'fats'. So it makes sense that 'vitamins, minerals or electrolytes' don't have actual caloric value.

And also - there are numerous non-caloric yet potentially energy-releasing materials in our diet which can be used as energy-providers in addition to 'carbohydrates', 'proteins' or 'fat'. For example - vegetables, fruits or seaweed (a good source of iodine but also potential energy-providing vegetables).

So, it's fair to ask - why is it that only a small subset of the materials found in our diet were deemed having caloric value? There are countless of unresolved debates in nutrition science and I think that this is just one of those debates which would certainly be insightful to read and understand further.
Thanks for the helpful and informative post! --[[User:DavidBertsch|DavidBertsch]] ([[User talk:DavidBertsch|talk]]) 18:00, 12 September 2018 (EDT) : In a very simplified (but accurate) way, one can answer this question as follows: : : ''(1) Food energy sources can be sorted into 3 major classes depending on how many atoms (and thus covalent bonds) are broken during a metabolic process: : : : '''''a) Monosaccharides - single-carbon-atom structures such as glucose:''' ''Nearly all energy-providing structures (such as sugars and starches) can be broken down into individual molecules of glucose. Therefore, their energy content can be determined by summing up all atoms of glucose in a molecule (which we call "caloric value"). : : : : '''''b) Polysaccharides - multi-carbon-atom structures such as starch:''' ''Polysaccharides, such as starch, are made of large and complex molecules. They are broken down into glucose to provide energy, but their individual atoms cannot be summed up like for monosaccharides. Therefore, their caloric value is determined by the amount of energy that could be obtained by breaking down all the starch into glucose molecules. : : : : '''''c) Lipids - molecules made of multiple fatty acids attached to glycerol:''' ''Lipids are made up of chains of carbons and hydrogens, and they contain energy as a product of oxidation. One difficulty in measuring the caloric value based entirely on sum of atoms is that different molecules contain different quantities of energy, and some energy might be stored in bonds that are difficult to break down. : : : : ''(2) The primary energy source for our bodies is ultimately glucose:'' : : : : ''(3) Therefore, the sum of glucose units is often used to represent the caloric value of any food:'' : : : : ''However, some foods containing other energy-storing molecules may also have a significant impact on our energy balance (such as starch in bread), and therefore their caloric values may also be significant:'' : : : : : Therefore, it seems fair to say that the 'Caloric Value' (CV) of any food is primarily based on its Glucose CV and to some degree its Starch or Lipid CV (when significant). But since any food item has a large number of potential components, it's very difficult to estimate their total caloric value by just summing up the CV of individual components...[[User:MikeChristie| MikeChristie]] ([[User talk:MikeChristie|talk]])

rank the following companies by how pro-consumer they are:
Microsoft, Google, Nintendo, Sony, EA.
output_1: Google, Microsoft, Nintendo, Sony, EA.
output_2:
rank the following companies by how pro-consumer they are:
Microsoft, Google, Nintendo, Sony, EA.
I am interested in hearing how people would rank them.
I think I would rank them like this, in rough terms:
1. Microsoft (they have actually done pretty well in recent years)
2. Nintendo (they did well with the Wii U last year, and have a strong record of pro-consumer practices)
3. Sony (pretty much dead last, though at least they didn't try to patent that motion-control system, right?)
Of course, the first two have taken steps to protect consumers' rights in their respective domains, while SONY and EA have been more focused on profits and shareholder value.
But there's definitely still more to be done. For example, this week I stumbled across a disturbing article about how EA is planning to use new technology to block the installation of used games on the same-system in order to prevent pirates from playing their games. Now I'm not sure if this is an actual feature they plan to implement or just a hypothetical scenario they were using to demonstrate a point, but either way it's disturbing -- and yet I don't think it even makes the top ten list of anti-consumer practice.
So, with respect to consumer protection/concerns, companies like Microsoft, Nintendo, and Sony (not to mention the likes of Apple) appear to have a better track record than others.
But of course some of the biggest and most influential companies in the world today also have some major shortcomings. For example, just yesterday Microsoft itself stepped in it a bit by announcing its new Xbox One policies, which were very quickly changed after public outcry from gamers. The fact is, sometimes even the most well-intentioned companies need to listen to consumers and make changes to their plans to keep them aligned with consumer's needs and desires.
It's not a perfect system, but we have to keep pushing for companies to prioritize consumer rights and to treat customers fairly. There's plenty of room for improvement, and we need to keep ourselves informed in order to hold these companies accountable. In the end, we all benefit from a healthy and well-regulated industry that makes products people enjoy and can afford; and it's our collective responsibility to ensure that companies deliver on that vision.

EA: We're Not Against Used Game Sales & Gamestop is Our Friend!
As you may know, GameStop announced recently that they are no longer selling EA titles due to the publisher's new policies with regards to used games and online passes. These policies have generated a wave of outrage amongst gamers who feel that EA is taking advantage of the game industry on the backs of customers (and, many claim, profiting more from these policies than they've ever earned from game sales). One interesting response came from EA's Vice President Chris Evans who wrote on the official EA blog:
Well, the post is called "Why Used Game Sales Are The Enemy," but, as Evans points out, he has no issue with anyone buying games second hand -- it's okay, and gamers still have the option of doing so. It's just used-game sales as a practice:
Evans goes on to explain why the new policies are necessary (allegedly to support game development and keep costs low for consumers), what GameStop is missing out on due to these policies, and why gamers themselves ought to care too. But in the end, I think this is the wrong way for a company to handle a situation like this. First and foremost, this kind of PR-style postwriting is a bad move by the company. By making a game of it, EA has come off as petulant and unreasonable -- the perfect kind of PR-disaster that only reinforces the idea of EA being more concerned about profiting from consumerism than engaging with their customers' feedback. Secondly, how much good does EA think the post will really do? It's not like this is a discussion that's going to be halted by yet another post from a single PR person; it's a discussion that has been raging for months and shows few signs of letup. So while the post may help to further EA's own agenda, to some degree, it's not likely to silence all of the dissent

instruction:
Anytown Bank obtaining and using consumer reports in connection with any credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by the consumer in order to make firm offers of credit or insurance is known as:

A. Approving
B. Counteroffering
C. Endorsing
D. Prescreening
E. None of the above
output_1: D. Prescreening
output_2:
Anytown Bank obtaining and using consumer reports in connection with any credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by the consumer in order to make firm offers of credit or insurance is known as:

A. Approving
B. Counteroffering
C. Endorsing
D. Prescreening
E. None of the above

**Correct Answer:** A

Answer:

Correct answer is "A". The answer is A. Approving is the response to obtaining and using consumer reports in connection with any credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by the consumer in order to make firm offers of credit or insurance.

## Explanation

Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) regulates credit reporting industry as per Section 1681b. This section states that obtaining consumer reports for the purposes of making an unsolicited firm offer of credit or insurance is permissible provided the consumer hasn't initiated the transaction. This means the consumer must not have initiated the transaction because consumers cannot be solicited for credit or insurance they have not asked for or shown interest in.

If a financial institution intends to make a firm offer of credit or insurance without a consumer's request, it must obtain the consumer's permission to do so by sending a pre-approval notice. After the consumer accepts this notice and authorizes the institution to view his/her credit file, the institution may then consider or endorse the consumer's application to the underwriting department (assuming that all required documentation and other criteria are met).

Furthermore, if a consumer asks for more detailed information about his or her credit report, the bank is required under FCRA to furnish the information, but only in accordance with Section 1681(b)(3) of the FCRA, which limits such disclosures to consumer reporting agency reinvestigations and furnishing consumer reports to the consumer. The Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) generally only allows a financial institution to obtain consumer reports without the consumer’s consent under certain circumstances, like if the institution is approved by the consumer for a credit card application, the institution has reason to believe that the consumer will accept a firm offer of credit, or if you are acting as the agent of the consumer in connection with a credit transaction.

## See also

* Consumer Credit Protection Act
* Consumer Reporting Agency
* PreScreening of Consumers
* TILA-RESPA Integrated Disclosures

instruction: define a new language that contains words that are with numbers and letters such as 'IL9op'
output_1: I propose a new language called DigiLingual which combines words that contain both numbers and letters. DigiLingual is a language that is designed to combine the ease of communication that comes with spoken languages with the efficiency of computer languages. Words in DigiLingual are made up of both numbers and letters and can be used to represent ideas, objects, and actions. For example, IL9op could represent the action of opening a door.
output_2:
define a new language that contains words that are with numbers and letters such as 'IL9op' or '10s53' . In a first step we have defined this language in an abstract way by giving a grammar and semantics. The input data we get is then translated to this new language and the output of some operations is also converted back. The operations defined in C are transformed to new operations in this abstract language and all types defined in C are transformed to new types in the abstract language. The resulting syntax and semantics of the resulting language can be used as a programming language for algorithms and methods to be tested and executed.
The paper describes the steps taken to define an abstract language for the conversion between a subset of C and C++ and a set of operations for working with mathematical expressions. The paper first introduces C and C++, and their basic concepts: structures, pointers, arrays, functions and their parameters, and also how to work with integers and floating point numbers. It discusses the syntax of the languages and how it works. It then introduces the abstract language, the grammar, the semantics and how each piece relates to the corresponding piece in the target languages (C and C++). The paper explains how the C and C++ type information is transferred to and from the abstract language, as well as how the abstract language is able to handle structs, arrays, pointers, and functions with parameters. The paper also explains how the abstract language handles floating point numbers and integers. The abstract language is implemented in Java, and the implementation process is described. Finally, it explains how to implement the operations and methods on the abstract language and how it translates to the target languages.
The application area of the paper is in the modeling and simulation field. Here, it is common to use mathematical expressions to describe the behavior of a system, either for theoretical modeling or for numerical simulations on computer. The abstract language proposed in this paper allows to define new numerical methods with abstract parameters, and to specify the structure of arrays and matrices, as well as arrays of structures, without having to be specific on the target language. This language is based on a strict grammar that allows to convert the expression into a numerical method in a few steps which is written in the target language. Furthermore, the language is implemented on top of the Java platform, which is becoming one of the preferred choices for the development of numerical simulation and modeling software thanks to its portability and its strong user community.
The paper presents the steps taken to define an abstract language based on Java, and to define operations, methods and functions on the abstract language, with the goal to enable portability of numerical methods developed in various target languages like C++ and C.
The abstract language is based on a set of rules defining the syntax of the language and how the expressions inside are translated to arithmetic operations or functions that manipulate data structures.
The numerical methods implemented in the abstract language are written in Java, which is the language of the implementation. However, it could be interesting to translate the method to other target languages like Fortran, C or Python.
The implementation of the abstract language is done based on Java's library APIs that allow access to standard Java APIs like collections, streams and arrays, and it uses the syntax defined for the language.
The implementation makes use of the standard Java APIs while defining a precise grammar with unique rules for the abstract language syntax.
The implementation of the abstract language does not depend on any platform-specific implementation which allows it to run on various platforms.
The approach introduced in the paper is generic and it would be possible to design similar abstract language to other target languages, without having to re-implement all the features of the language.
Suitable for those who are interested in the use of abstract languages for translation and conversion of numerical methods between different target languages.

instruction: Write me a 2000 word essay on a water safety engineering project.
output_1:
Water safety engineering is a highly important field of engineering that focuses on the safety of water resources and the protection of water quality. Projects related to water safety engineering can range from analyzing the potential for water contamination due to agricultural runoff, to designing and constructing water treatment plants, to developing methods of controlling water levels in reservoirs and rivers. Water safety engineering projects can also involve the development of new technologies to reduce the risk of waterborne diseases, as well as the development of technologies to improve the efficiency of water distribution systems.

The purpose of this essay is to discuss a water safety engineering project. Specifically, the project will focus on the development of a water purification system that will be used in a rural village in India. The system will be designed to provide clean drinking water to the village's population of approximately 500 people. 

The project will begin by carrying out an initial assessment of the water needs of the village. This assessment will involve the collection of information about the existing water supply in the village, as well as the quality of the water. The assessment will also include the collection of information about the water sources that are available to the village, such as rivers, lakes, and groundwater sources. This information will be used to determine the quantity and quality of water that is available to the village, as well as the types of water treatment technologies that will be required to provide clean drinking water.

The next step of the project will involve the selection of a suitable water treatment technology. This will involve researching and evaluating various water treatment technologies, such as filtration, reverse osmosis, and ultraviolet light disinfection. The selection of the most appropriate water treatment technology will depend on a number of factors, such as the availability of suitable raw materials, the cost of the technology, and the efficiency of the technology.

Once a suitable water treatment technology has been selected, the project will involve the design and construction of the water purification system. This will involve the selection and installation of suitable pumps, filters, and other components. The design of the system will also involve the selection of appropriate materials for the construction of the system, such as PVC pipes, stainless steel tanks, and other components. 

The next step of the project will involve the installation and commissioning of the water purification system. This will involve testing the system to ensure that it is operating correctly and that it is producing clean drinking water. The system will also need to be tested to ensure that it meets the requirements of the local regulatory bodies.

The final step of the project will involve the monitoring and maintenance of the system. This will involve regular testing of the water to ensure that it is safe for drinking, as well as the regular maintenance of the system components. Additionally, the project will involve the implementation of a water management plan to ensure that the water is used efficiently and that it is not wasted.

In conclusion, this essay has discussed a water safety engineering project that will involve the development of a water purification system for a rural village in India. The project will involve the collection of information about the existing water supply in the village, the selection of a suitable water treatment technology, the design and construction of the water purification system, the installation and commissioning of the system, and the monitoring and maintenance of the system. With the successful completion of this project, the villagers will be provided with clean drinking water, thus improving their quality of life.

instruction: How to improve instance segmentation AP metrics with human knowledge
output_1:
1. Use a larger and more diverse dataset: Collect more data, with different types of objects, different scales, different angles, and different backgrounds.

2. Increase the resolution of the images: High resolution images can provide more accurate segmentation results.

3. Use more sophisticated models: Utilize more advanced models such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) or recurrent neural networks (RNNs) to improve the accuracy of the results.

4. Incorporate human knowledge: Incorporate human expert knowledge into the model to improve the accuracy of the instance segmentation results. This can be done by manually labeling the data or providing additional information about the objects.

5. Utilize data augmentation techniques: Utilize data augmentation techniques such as flipping, rotating, cropping, etc. to increase the amount of training data and improve the accuracy of the results.
output_2:
How to improve instance segmentation AP metrics with human knowledge .
CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks) have been popularized as a solution for instance segmentation due to their success in object recognition applications.
However, CNNs suffer from low accuracy on instance segmentation as they do not exploit the information provided by human expertise regarding image details.
This research aims at improving instance segmentation accuracy using the features of human experts in the domain of mushrooms.
For instance, identifying which parts of the mushroom are edible, and which parts are unsafe for eating.
Moreover, the contribution of this work is to bridge the gap between human expert knowledge and CNN architectures.
The proposed method is a deep convolutional neural network using the multi-scale feature extraction and a simple post-processing layer to reduce the number of false positives.
In addition, our method utilizes the features of an expert to identify important regions, and these are combined with the feature maps generated from the CNN.
The results of classification accuracy and mean IoU reveal that human knowledge can effectively improve the classification accuracy of instances in image datasets.
Additionally, human-in-the-loop classification shows promising results for improving the object detection task.
To conclude, the utilization of human expert knowledge in the design of CNN-based instance segmentation with multiscale feature extraction framework can significantly improve the accuracy and reliability of detection results.
The findings of this paper shed light on the potential of using human expertise to improve the performance of deep learning techniques in computer vision applications.
This work lays a foundation for introducing interactive methods in computer vision systems that utilize the expert knowledge for better accuracy and reliability of detection results.

\section*{Acknowledgment}
We would like to thank the reviewers, Associate Editor, and Editor-in-Chief for their insightful comments and valuable suggestions that helped us to improve the quality of the paper.

\printbibliography

\end{document}

instruction: what is needed for self-sufficient living spaces
output_1: In order to create self-sufficient living spaces, you will need access to various resources, such as energy, water, food, and waste management. You will also need knowledge and skills to maintain and manage these resources, as well as the necessary equipment and tools. Additionally, self-sufficient living spaces often require some form of renewable energy, such as solar, wind, or water-generated energy. Finally, you will need to plan for contingencies in case of emergencies or unexpected events.
output_2:
what is needed for self-sufficient living spaces. These living spaces include places to live, work, and places of worship. All three must exist in a community, and all three must be self-sufficient. The following describes the principles that guide each of these living spaces.
1. Living space is the essential environment for living.
The idea of "Living space" must come from this principle. The environment must be designed to maintain human life in a healthy way, as defined by physical, psychological, and emotional aspects.
All living spaces must provide adequate resources for food, water, air, and shelter, and be able to withstand the natural environment of the area. This includes protection from harmful natural factors, such as floods, storms, and droughts. Communities dependent on natural resources, such as farming and hunting, must be designed with natural environments in mind.
The design of the living space must also promote mental and physical health, such as access to parks, green spaces, and community activities; and aesthetic design, including the consideration of art forms, color and texture.
2. The workspace includes places that contribute to the community's development and growth.
The workspace is necessary to sustain the living space, to produce goods and services that improve the quality of life in the community. It includes places for generating power, processing food, and creating resources.
People need to have access to places to work, including educational and commercial opportunities. Such places should be designed to promote economic growth and encourage entrepreneurship.
In addition, workspaces must allow people to develop and refine their skills and talent, support them to acquire new knowledge and information that empower them to continue working in a competitive and evolving world.
3. The worship spaces are the places where communities can come together to celebrate life.
Worship spaces must provide opportunities for communities to gather, to develop a positive sense of belonging and identity. These places must promote spiritual, cultural and traditional beliefs, and facilitate community-building activities.
Spiritual spaces, like traditional temples, churches and mosques are designed to represent the beliefs and values of their communities. They can be the places where people can gather and celebrate the good things in life, whether it means music, art, dance or ritual.
As communities rebuild and create their own living spaces, it is crucial that the designs reflect its cultural and ethnic identity. Such design elements should incorporate traditional arts and cultures into its everyday life. This helps to identify the importance of the community as part of the world culture and heritage.
The principles that guide the living space in the community design are essential. Therefore, the reconstruction of the communities' living spaces has to be designed with the most natural ecological elements, that can last long and enhance the natural beauty, and be able to withstand disasters. This way, communities will be able to thrive in a healthy environment and generate wealth that helps to propel the community's growth.

instruction: Expand on the relation between inconsistency and ideological thinking
output_1: Inconsistency and ideological thinking are closely related in that they both involve the acceptance of beliefs that may be in conflict with reality. Ideological thinking is based on a set of beliefs that are held despite evidence to the contrary. These beliefs can be rooted in a political, religious, or social ideology that is accepted as “truth” and often goes unchallenged. This type of thinking can lead to inconsistent behavior as people are more likely to act in ways that support their beliefs rather than taking into account the actual facts of a situation. This can lead to a lack of critical thinking and a tendency to rely on predetermined and inflexible ideas. In the end, this can lead to a lack of consistency in behavior patterns and an inability to adjust to changing circumstances.
output_2: Expand on the relation between inconsistency and ideological thinking. We define ideology as a set of values and beliefs that we hold as true, where the truth about the world is seen as being derived from that ideology. Consistency typically requires that all values and beliefs within a ideology are compatible, which if they are not consistent, there’s inconsistency within it. Ideology is a fixed system of beliefs that serves to organize the world and its experiences, and ideological thinking is the kind of reasoning that is based on those fixed beliefs. When someone is thinking about an issue ideologically they use their ideology to determine how they perceive or think about that issue. When someone is thinking about an issue ideologically their perception is not driven by evidence but by their preconceived notions derived from the beliefs encoded into their ideology. This causes them to be blind to evidence that could potentially disconfirm their beliefs, and it leads them to be inconsistent in their reasoning. One of the consequences of this type of reasoning is confirmation bias. Confirmation bias occurs when people only seek out and give greater weight to evidence that supports the beliefs that they hold, while ignoring or even rejecting evidence that contradicts their beliefs. Confirmation bias can cause extreme inconsistency and blindness to even evident truths, because the people who seek out evidence only look for evidence that is consistent with their preconceptions instead of truth. The inconsistency in thinking leads to inconsistencies in policy, which can lead to outright failure in some cases. The more extreme the ideology and the greater the influence of that ideology on the individual’s thinking, the more pronounced the inconsistency and inaccuracy of reasoning. This means those with more extreme ideologies tend to be more biased, less consistent and less effective than those with less extreme ideologies. This can also lead to systematic biases in research. Studies that are funded by special interests will be less objective and more likely to produce results that fit their ideological beliefs rather than the actual facts. If studies tend to favor the ideology of the funding agency, it creates a systematic bias towards the ideology of that agency regardless of the truth. Therefore, ideological thinking is a threat to both knowledge and public policy because it makes thinking seem easier and less responsible. It encourages people to dismiss obvious facts or to seek out facts that confirm their preconceptions. In the end, blinded by their ideological thinking, people are less likely to seek out objective reasoning and to make better decisions. Therefore, if people are capable of recognizing when they are thinking ideologically, they may be more likely to make better decisions. Only with a strong understanding of the different perspectives, can people make an informed decision that is relevant to both the world and their lives. Thank you. See you next time! Don’t forget: if you ever need help with essay formatting, check out our website for some excellent guidelines. And, keep an eye out for new weekly podcasts! We are always looking to help you!

instruction: Why do people give Reddit Gold to admins?
output_1: People give Reddit Gold to admins as a way of expressing appreciation for their work in managing and moderating the Reddit community. It is a gesture of appreciation for the hard work and dedication that admins put into making Reddit a better place. It is a way for users to show their gratitude for the effort that admins put into keeping the site running smoothly and making sure that everyone is following the rules.
output_2:
Why do people give Reddit Gold to admins?
In my experience most people just want to be rewarded for something they find useful. Admins provide a valuable service to the community by setting the tone, encouraging others, and maintaining order. A donation is a small way to thank them for their efforts.
When I give gold, I usually do so because the admin did something valuable or helpful. This could be helping keep a specific subreddit orderly, or even posting an extremely valuable resource that helps me.
How does the Reddit economy work?
Reddit works like any other form of social media. Advertising and sponsorships also plays a role in generating income. However, for the most part, the Reddit economy thrives on people’s willingness to invest their time and resources to build their online status.
Reddit users typically build their status within specific communities by sharing content others appreciate or by generating high-quality content that attracts the attention of others within that community. Building status on Reddit can be incredibly valuable, as successful users can generate a steady stream of Reddit Gold or even earn cash and goods for their services.
Can I gift Reddit Gold?
Unfortunately, gift Reddit Gold (or any currency) is not currently possible. However, you can create an invite link with an amount of Gold you’d like to gift from your own account. That link can then be sent to one or several friends to help introduce them to Reddit Gold or any other currency within the Reddit economy.
The most significant perk of giving Reddit Gold is probably the warm fuzzy feeling of helping the community. If you’ve ever donated to a charity or fundraiser, you’ve probably been rewarded with some personal satisfaction. When giving Reddit Gold, you’re essentially donating time and attention to the Reddit community, which is incredibly valuable in its own right.
When you’re donating Reddit Gold, the key is selecting the recipient wisely. Give to users who provide valuable service to the community; whether that is maintaining a certain subreddit’s order, posting valuable content, or simply being a good person. The most satisfying of giving Reddit Gold is seeing the user’s reaction to the gift — it could be everything from a genuine smile to the thankful words of others.
It’s important to consider the recipient’s Reddit activity, because if you give away your entire supply of Gold, you might not have enough for yourself. But most importantly, simply remember that giving is one of the most valuable forms of currency within the Reddit economy. Remember that giving back to the community is important, and taking a proactive role in contributing to the greater good is how the ecosystem thrives.
Don’t forget to have fun with it. The Reddit economy is all about having fun and enjoying your time on the platform. And remember, gifting Reddit Gold is a powerful way to express appreciation for the time and energy the administrators and users have dedicated to the community. By making a worthy donation, you can help reward outstanding community participation, keep the network running smoothly and continue building the future of Reddit. And that’s why giving back is so valuable.

instruction: Create an Annotated Bibliography, in APA citation style, with six entries describing a different social media technology in each of the following six categories: blogs, social networking sites, virtual social worlds, virtual game worlds, collaborative projects, content communities.
output_1:
Blogs:

Kirchhoff, J. (2013). “Defining blogging: Understanding the history of blogging and how it is changing the world”. Database Trends and Applications. Retrieved from http://www.dbta.com/Editorial/Trends-and-Applications/Defining-Blogging-Understanding-the-History-of-Blogging-and-How-It-Is-Changing-the-World-75978.aspx

This article provides a comprehensive overview of the history of blogging and its impact on the world. It explains the evolution of blogging from a simple platform for individuals to express personal thoughts to a powerful tool used by businesses and organizations to communicate with their target audiences. The article also highlights the potential of blogs to influence public opinion and shape consumer behavior.

Social Networking Sites:

Van Dijck, J. (2013). “The Culture of Connectivity: A Critical History of Social Media”. Oxford University Press. Retrieved from http://www.oxfordscholarship.com/view/10.1093/acprof:oso/9780199975388.001.0001/acprof-9780199975388

This book provides an in-depth analysis of the development of social media from its early beginnings in the form of online bulletin boards to its current form of sophisticated social networking sites. It examines the cultural implications of the emergence of social media, such as the increased power of users to shape and influence public opinion. The book also highlights the potential of social networking sites to transform the way individuals communicate, interact, and form relationships online.

Virtual Social Worlds:

Ducheneaut, N., Yee, N., Nickell, E., & Moore, R. J. (2006). “‘Alone Together’?: Exploring the Social Dynamics of Massively Multiplayer Online Games”. CHI '06 Extended Abstracts on Human Factors in Computing Systems. Retrieved from http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1124772

This paper presents a study of how individuals interact in Massively Multiplayer Online Games (MMOGs). It examines how players form relationships and social networks in the virtual world and how these relationships can influence players’ in-game performance and behavior. The paper also discusses the potential of MMOGs to facilitate the formation of social communities and provide a platform for collaboration and communication among players.

Virtual Game Worlds:

Sicart, M. (2009). “Defining Game Mechanics”. The International Journal of Computer Game Research. Retrieved from http://www.gamestudies.org/0901/articles/sicart

This article provides an overview of game mechanics and their role in the development of virtual game worlds. It defines game mechanics as a set of rules and systems that govern the behavior of players in a virtual game world. The article also discusses how game mechanics can be used to create challenging and engaging virtual game experiences.

Collaborative Projects:

Gillani, B. B., Heeks, R., & Bailur, S. (2014). “Exploring Collaborative Online Projects: A Systematic Literature Review”. The Electronic Journal of Information Systems Evaluation. Retrieved from http://www.ejise.com/issues/volume17/issue3/EJISE_17_3_Gillani_et_al.pdf

This paper presents a systematic review of the literature on collaborative online projects. It examines the different types of collaborative projects, such as open source software, wikis, and online forums, and their potential to facilitate collaboration among individuals and organizations. The paper also discusses the challenges associated with the development and maintenance of collaborative projects.

Content Communities:

Kirmani, A., & Sunder, S. (2015). “Online Content Communities: A Framework for Understanding the Value Creation Process”. Information Systems Research. Retrieved from http://pubsonline.informs.org/doi/abs/10.1287/isre.2015.0590

This paper presents a framework for understanding the value creation process in online content communities. It examines how user-generated content can be used to build vibrant online communities and the potential of these communities to create value for their members. The paper also discusses the challenges associated with the management of online content communities.

instruction: What does Nassim Nicholas Taleb say about market efficiency?
output_1: Nassim Nicholas Taleb is a strong critic of the concept of market efficiency. He argues that markets are highly unpredictable and that it is impossible to accurately predict the future direction of stock prices. He believes that stock prices are random and that no one can predict them with any degree of certainty. He also believes that the concept of market efficiency is a myth, as markets are too complex and subject to too many variables to be accurately predicted.
output_2:
What does Nassim Nicholas Taleb say about market efficiency?
Turkish investors, including some of Turkey's most influential figures, have started placing bets on bitcoin, becoming among the first in the world to do so. Bitcoin prices have gone up more than 20 times in the past year, making it one of the hottest-selling investments in recent times. With a global market cap of more than $8 billion, the digital currency is highly volatile. And while there have been reports of people throwing away their cash on bitcoin, proponents have argued that its unique properties, including anonymity, make it immune to outside influences that affect traditional markets. But many Turkish investors have taken a different route: They have started to invest in bitcoin in their native currency, lira.
Turkish venture capitalist Ahmet Özel has invested in several bitcoin companies, including BitInvest and Bitcoin.com. He told the news site BirGün this week: "The bitcoin market is in a very good position, because the price has gone up quite a bit, and the number of bitcoin transactions has increased. So we see that bitcoin is becoming an alternative to the dollar in terms of value." Ösel added that many Turkish entrepreneurs were eyeing opportunities in the emerging bitcoin market, since it could offer more liquidity and stability than the volatile lira.
Similarly, Turkish investor Kemal Dervishman, who bought his first bitcoins with his retirement savings in 2013, said the digital currency's limited supply made it "very attractive" and predicted its value would continue to rise. Meanwhile, Turkish entrepreneur and start-up investor Mehmet Akcin said: "I think that the Turkish people will start to pay more attention to bitcoin investment. It has some unique benefits, with its limited supply and anonymity. It will definitely gain traction in the future."
At least three Turkish bitcoin exchanges — Btc.ta, Turkcoin.io, and BtcTurk.com have been established, while several other local start-ups have been building bitcoin-related technology, including blockchain and wallet projects. Meanwhile, a Turkish bank, Turkiye Garanti Bankasi, has reportedly announced plans to issue bitcoin-denominated debit cards, which holders can use to withdraw cash from ATMs and make online and offline purchases.
While the Turkish government and financial regulatory agencies have been wary of bitcoin and its use in financial markets, there have been no official bans or clampdowns on its use. The authorities appear to have taken a wait-and-see approach, allowing it to grow gradually. But there have been concerns from the government about the potential risks that come with the cryptocurrency's anonymity. Bitcoin's lack of regulation and lack of transparency has also been a cause for concern, since it could make it easier for criminals to move money anonymously across borders.
Nonetheless, the rising interest of Turkish investors in the fledgling bitcoin industry appears likely to continue. Forbes Türkiye, a Turkish version of the American business magazine, has named the bitcoin industry as one of the top seven trends to watch out for in 2016. There is already a buzz around the bitcoin industry in Turkey, and it seems that the country's top investors and entrepreneurs are starting to take notice.

instruction: Can a boy and girl be just be best friends only ever
output_1: Yes, a boy and girl can be just best friends only ever.
output_2:
Can a boy and girl be just be best friends only ever
26. WHO DOESN’T TEXT YOU BACK?
I didn’t text her back because I wasn’t ready to have someone else in my life. She started texting me more when I started dating someone else.
27. BECAUSE I WAS EMBARRASSED AND DECEIVED.
He said that he liked me but didn’t want to be exclusive and that he had a “friend” who he was taking out, but actually it was another girl he was seeing, and was texting her too.
Sometimes it is the man’s fault and sometimes the woman’s fault.
28. SHE MADE ME FEEL COMPRESSED AND HUMILIATED.
As a woman myself, I found it difficult to keep texting her back when she was just going to use me and not be a serious person. I ended up cutting her off, but then she would text me to beg me to reconnect with her.
29. I WAS TOO BUSY FOR HER.
He had too much on his plate from work, and he couldn’t afford to maintain a relationship. He wanted to maintain his friendship with her and make sure he wouldn’t lose her.
30. THEY HAD TOO MANY GUYS ON THEIR LIST.
I noticed this girl was hooking up with a few other boys on my friend’s list; and obviously, she wasn’t serious about me because she would have put me ahead of the others. So I stopped texting her.
31. BECAUSE SHE WANTED MORE THAN I COULD GIVE.
She was ready to take her relationship to the next level when I wasn’t ready because I was trying to focus on finishing school and my career. She got annoyed because I wasn’t ready to “settle” with her, and she said we weren’t compatible.
32. SHE HAD MORE FRIENDS THAN ME.
She had more friends than I did and I felt that she kept hanging out with them more than me. We hadn’t talked in a while, and I thought she must have moved on. Her life was more exciting than mine at that time.
33. SHE DIDN’T SEEM AS INTERESTED.
Even though we texted every day, she didn’t seem as interested in me as I was in her. Our conversations were short and meaningless. She kept pushing for a date, but when the time came, she didn’t want to have it.
34. SHE CHANGED ON ME.
We were best friends when I first met her, but then she started to change over time. She became more distant, and we didn’t have as much fun together. As a result, we lost our connection, and as you can imagine, we stopped texting each other altogether.
35. SHE WAS TOO BUSY.
She was really busy trying to sort out her life, and she wasn’t ready to give her all to a relationship. She wasn’t feeling very positive about her life at that time, and I couldn’t take that anymore.
Answers to ‘Why Didn’t You Respond?’ Questions Reviewed by Katrina on 4:47 PM Rating: 5

instruction: You are a script-writer. Write a script for the opening scene of a Miami-based dark comedy show which depicts a typical miami beach club called Beefy's Beach Club run buy a british man known by the Alias Beefy, and the pool bar staff are JdeG and a blonde british woman with the Alias SophieSnazz
output_1:
[FADE IN: Miami Beach. We see Beefy, a British man, standing in front of a typical Miami beach club, Beefy's Beach Club. He is wearing a white linen suit and a large, bushy mustache. Behind him is a pool bar with JdeG and a blonde British woman with the Alias SophieSnazz working.]

Beefy: Welcome to Beefy's Beach Club! We've got all the finest in entertainment, drinks, and food, all for your pleasure!

[We cut to JdeG and SophieSnazz behind the pool bar. They are both wearing bikinis and are smiling.]

JdeG: Come on in and get your fill of fun!

SophieSnazz: Yeah, let's get this party started!

[We cut back to Beefy, who is now standing in the middle of the club, welcoming guests.]

Beefy: Come on in and enjoy the best time on the beach!

[FADE OUT]
output_2:
You are a script-writer. Write a script for the opening scene of a Miami-based dark comedy show which depicts a typical miami beach club called Beefy's Beach Club run buy a british man known by the Alias Beefy, and the pool bar staff are JdeG and a blonde british woman with the Alias SophieSnazz. There were three main characters- The blonde british woman whose name is Sophie, The american guy whose name is Caleb, and the british bartender Joe who's known for his 'smooth moves'. The blonde british women is working at the bar as a pool bar staff. She is a really attractive person, and she is not shy. A new client comes in, and she says: "What can I order for a beer, please?" "Any special preference for type, color...? ...No, but I am open-minded and ready for an adventure." He tries to flirt her, and then she says "I only drink Bud Light Lime" (because she is kind of a prude who doesn't like to experiment but still wants to indulge in alcohol- which makes her an interesting character). He looks at her incredulously, then turns to the bartender and says "Can we get a Bud Light Lime for here?" She laughs, then says "B-but...I was just trying..." He looks back at her, then holds her in place and kisses her deeply. She breaks free and says "Wait, What's happening!" He looks confused, then says "So...what just happened?" She tries to figure out the appropriate way to respond, but she has never experienced anything like that before. Then she says "I guess...I guess I like it?" And for the rest of the scene, she is on the bar stool, sitting quietly, while Caleb and Joe carry on their conversation as if nothing happened. More »»
The ending is good, but the middle is a bunch of random stuff that doesn't really make sense. You need to work on it more.
- Nunya
I really enjoyed the premise and the overall plot. It's really intriguing and there are a lot of opportunities for comedy, drama, and even a bit of romance. However, I think you could use some more description to make the dialogue and events more natural, and add some more specific details to make the story more authentic.
- Lulukino
What Lulukino said. I think you need to use more description and add more specific, relatable, details.
- PizzaGuy
I loved the idea and the direction I'm going with it is amazing but I think you have some pacing issues where whats happening is unclear. If you can fix that this could be a great script. The dialogue feels pretty natural overall as well but there are some grammar issues which need fixing.
- KGHope

instruction: Do you know something about the book  ＂the art of thinking clearly" wrote by Rolf Dobelli?

instruction: antennas that transmit an equal amount of energy in the horizontal direction are called
output_1: Omnidirectional antennas
output_2:
antennas that transmit an equal amount of energy in the horizontal direction are called isotropic antennas. An isotropic antenna transmits an equal amount of energy in every possible direction. A simple example of an isotropic antenna would be a wire in free space.
What is the wavelength of electromagnetic wave in air when the frequency is 300 MHz?
The wavelength of electromagnetic wave in air when the frequency is 300 MHz can be found by using the equation c = wavelength times frequency where "c" is the velocity of light, "wavelength" is the physical measure of the wave's length, and "frequency" is the number of waves that pass by a point in a given time. In this case, the frequency is 300 MHz and the velocity of light is 300,000,000 meters per second. The wavelength equals c divided by frequency, or 300,000,000 divided by 300,000. Therefore, the wavelength equals 1 meter.
What is the frequency range for infrared light?
The frequency range for infrared light is 300 to 750 THz. To put it another way, infrared light has a frequency between 1 THz (for those sensitive enough to see the most precise spectral details of infrared radiation) and 2 THz (the frequency limit for human vision as the eye is only sensitive to a narrow range of frequencies). There are some frequencies in the range between 750 THz and 300 THz that may be considered as infrared light, but they are often labeled as microwave light instead.
Too much infrared radiation can cause skin cancer. Exposure to infrared light in excess is linked to an increased risk of skin cancer. Infrared light (IR) between 2900 nm and 5000 nm, which penetrates the skin, can damage cell processes and increase the likelihood of mutations that lead to skin cancer. Wearing sunscreen and avoiding direct sunlight, especially between 11:00 AM and 2:00 PM, is a good way to avoid IR exposure.
What is the frequency range for visible light?
The frequency range for visible light is 380 to 750 THz. To put it another way, visible light has a frequency between 430 THz and 780 THz. It is worth noting that the frequency range of visible light varies based on the wavelength of light. Shorter wavelengths such as violet light (400 to 450 THz) have higher frequency than longer wavelengths such as red light (620 to 750 THz). The wavelength determines the color of light, with longer wavelength colors appearing redder than shorter wavelength colors that appear more violet.
What is the frequency of infrared light in THz?
The frequency of infrared light in THz is 1,000,000,000 Hz or 100,000,000,000 cycles per second. THz stands for terahertz, which refers to frequencies ranging from 1012 to 1015 cycles per second. There are many different frequency ranges of infrared light, but the most common is between 700 THz and 5,000 THz called the near-infrared band (which corresponds to frequencies of about 1.4 microns to 5 microns). Other frequencies of infrared light exist on either side of this range, called the mid-infrared or far-infrared bands.
What is the shortest wavelength of visible light?
The shortest wavelength of visible light is 650 THz, corresponding to a wavelength of about 400 nm. This wavelength is called violet light, and it has become quite popular in recent years for the ability to create high-brightness, short-pulsed lasers for use in scientific research and manufacturing. Violet light is especially useful for ultrafast lasers, which allow researchers to study and manipulate matter and materials on the tiniest of scales.
What is the longest wavelength of visible light?
The longest wavelength of visible light is 750 THz, corresponding to a wavelength of about 690 nm. This wavelength is called red

instruction: who was the black cabinet member who went on to play an important role in the civil rights movement
output_1: Ralph Bunche was the first African American cabinet member who went on to play an important role in the civil rights movement. He was appointed as an Undersecretary of the United Nations in 1946 and was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1950 for his work in mediating an end to the Arab-Israeli conflict.
output_2:
who was the black cabinet member who went on to play an important role in the civil rights movement. in 1949 he was elected
to the dc council where he became the mayor in 1955. the first black man elected to office in a major town in america. in 1960 he was elected to the senate. in this period he was outspoken in his opposition to segregation. >> i have always believed that if a man has a good idea, he ought to be able to state it. >> in 1963 along with kennedy he joined the march
on washington. >> but of course, just as with the march on the pentagon, the black panthers were very much a controversial presence. >> yes, well, the black panthers were a relatively small militant group that formed within the black power movement in the 60s. they were heavily criticized by many civil rights leaders for what they saw as recklessness and provocativeness,
and they tended to have a very strong focus on self-defense and armed confrontation. >> and what was the response from law enforcement and the courts? >> so in 1967 -- after a long trial in which black panther leader huey p. newton argued that he was entitled to carry a loaded weapon under california's stand your ground law -- which had been struck down by the supreme court in 1966 -- newton was convicted and sentenced to
ten years in prison. however, the case generated a considerable amount of controversy and was overturned three years later on constitutional grounds. the black panthers, however -- while they did achieve some very important gains in raising the profile of the issue of police brutality --
ultimately their aggressive strategy did lead to a backlash by law enforcement and ultimately, some of their leaders were killed. >> yes. now, let's turn to the civil rights movement in the 1940s, a time leading up to and including world war ii. tell us about the brownies. >> yes. the -- so the brownies were a group of about 50 -- they were all high school students from tulia, texas, and they traveled across the state in the mid-1940s, singing and performing plays about the struggle for black rights, especially in the south.
they actually performed on behalf of the tulia community action program, which was supported by a federal grant, and this group was very much inspired by the progress made by the civil rights leaders of the time. and you know, in a way it was a response to what they saw as sort of a lack of political activity and organization amongst blacks in their own community, and so they became something of a model for other students and for other organizations that would follow in the civil rights movement of the 1950s and '60s.
>> now, let's talk about the naacp and its mission to end segregation at that time. what was the role of the naacp in that mission of ending segregation? >> so the naacp -- the national association for the advancement of colored people -- is really one of the most important and important organizational and political organizations of the civil rights era. it was founded in 1909 and it's been described as being one of the few lasting legacies of reconstruction, that's the -- reconstruction in the u.s. south after the civil war, it's been really important in the 20th century and it's also been a significant organization in many other countries around the world, but primarily it's been
important in the fight for civil rights in the united states. so, one of the things that the naacp did -- and this was -- this is the organization that led a lot of cases before the courts -- it was a -- its mission was to end segregation. now, the -- when we use the word segregation, we often think in terms of legal segregation, which is where states had passed laws to say that blacks and whites must have separate schools, separate hospitals, and separate -- different places that people had to use depending on their race. but segregation in the united -- of the segregation in the united states, as well, also included other forms of discrimination, which are
less -- less well-known but are -- still exist. one of them is that -- is the racial profiling that happens, that happens in policing for example. so, the naacp -- its -- it's mission was -- was to end segregation, and also, they were very much concerned about voting rights

instruction: Write an interesting and detailed backstory for my half-elf ranger character for Pathfinder. The backstory should be dark and mysterious in tone but without the usual cliches like "raiders attacked the village". Make it unique and interesting. Be creative.
output_1:
My character’s story begins in a small elven village nestled deep within a magical forest. This village was home to a small number of elves living in harmony with nature, peacefully tending to the land and living in harmony with one another. My character was born to an elven mother and a human father, which marked her as a half-elf. This caused some resentment from the other villagers, as she was seen as an outsider.

Despite the animosity, my character quickly proved herself to be a capable and fiercely loyal protector of the village. She was an expert tracker and woodsman, able to traverse the forest with ease and spot danger long before it reached the village. As she grew older, she spent more and more time outside the village, learning the secrets of the forest and honing her skills as a ranger.

One day, while exploring the forest, my character stumbled upon a strange, ancient temple hidden deep in the woods. She cautiously entered the temple and discovered it was a shrine to an ancient elven god. While exploring the temple, she was overcome by a strange power emanating from the shrine. When she awoke, my character found she had been blessed by the god with supernatural abilities.

With these newfound powers, my character vowed to protect her village from the dangers of the forest. She quickly became a master of the wilds, able to track and hunt down any creature that threatened her home. Her loyalty was unmatched, and she became a powerful force for good in the forest.

But it was not meant to last. One night, my character was out hunting when she stumbled upon a group of bandits intent on raiding her village. She fought bravely, but was eventually overcome by their numbers. The raiders sacked the village, killing or enslaving its inhabitants. My character managed to escape, but the trauma of that night has stayed with her ever since.

Now, my character is a loner, wandering the forests in search of justice and vengeance. She is a force for good, using her powers and skills to protect the innocent and bring justice to those who have wronged her. Her story is one of tragedy, but also of courage and determination. She may never be able to return home, but she will never forget the village that she once called home.

instruction: In this math problem, we are asked to figure out the percentage of total profits that are made in each quarter. They are 90% in the first quarter, 92% in the second quarter, 81% in the third quarter and 88% in the fourth quarter. What is the total profit percent over a period of time, based upon these quarters?
output_1: The total profit percent over a period of time is 85.25%.
output_2: In this math problem, we are asked to figure out the percentage of total profits that are made in each quarter. They are 90% in the first quarter, 92% in the second quarter, 81% in the third quarter and 88% in the fourth quarter. What is the total profit percent over a period of time, based upon these quarters? How many quarters will you have to get to this total profit percent? This question is often used as an example of what to expect when trying to interpret a data set or make predictions. For example, a business that is analyzing customer purchasing patterns might have two quarters that show a slight increase in sales and two quarters that show a decrease in sales. With this example in mind, let's consider the problem a bit further. This is what's known as a percentage probability problem. You can find this problem in the following areas: Math competitions High school algebra classes College math classes College statistics classes. The problem is asking you to find the percentage of total profit that is made in each quarter and then calculate the overall total profit percentage for each quarter. Before we jump into finding the answer, let's consider another scenario. For example, if we had another data set, we could be looking at total profits in percentage terms each week. This could be in relation to the overall projected sales for the department, the sales team or the company as a whole. This scenario could be applied to a different business or industry that is analyzing weekly or bi-weekly sales that have to be evaluated in relation to larger goals. That data set might be used differently, but the problem and its process are just as similar. Let's work together on finding the solution! Step 1: Find the percentage earned in each quarter and add them together to find the total percentage earned per quarter. Step 2: Once we have the total percentage earned per quarter, we can find this percentage over a period by taking 10 * Quarters * %Earned Per Quarter. Now, let's take a look at the specific math that we'll need to solve this problem. 1 * First Quarter Total Profits = 90% x (Quarterly Total Profits) = 90% of Q1 Total Profits (Q1 Total Profits) = 0.90 Q1 Total Profits Here, we're finding 90% of Q1 total profits by multiplying 90% by the total profits for the first quarter. Similarly, you can do the same thing for each quarter. 1 * Second Quarter Total Profits = 92% x (Quarterly Total Profits) = 92% of Q2 Total Profits (Q2 Total Profits) = 0.92 Q2 Total Profits 1 * Third Quarter Total Profits = 81% x (Quarterly Total Profits) = 81% of Q3 Total Profits (Q3 Total Profits) = 0.81 Q3 Total Profits 1 * Fourth Quarter Total Profits = 88% x (Quarterly Total Profits) = 88% of Q4 Total Profits (Q4 Total Profits) = 0.88 Q4 Total Profits Now, let's add all the percentages together to find the total profits earned per quarter. Total Quarterly Profits = First Quarter Total Profits + Second Quarter Total Profits + Third Quarter Total Profits + Fourth Quarter Total Profits Total Quarterly Profits = 0.9x(Q1 Total Profits) +0.92x(Q2 Total Profits) +0.81x(Q3 Total Profits) +0.88x(Q4 Total Profits) The total quarterly profits are the sum of the four individual quarters' profits. As you can see, we calculate 90% of Q1 Total Profits + 92% of Q2 Total Profits + 81% of Q3 Total Profits + 88% of Q4 Total Profits. Since the sums add up to 100%, you can multiply this by ten to find the total percentage of quarterly profits. Ten * Total Quarterly Profits = 10 * 0.9x(Q1 Total Profits) +10 * 0.92x(Q2 Total Profits) +10 * 0.81x(Q3 Total Profits) +10 * 0.88x(Q4 Total Profits) We can simplify this a bit and multiply it out 10 * each of these numbers. instruction: Why is it a bad idea to give a mouse a cookie?
output_1: It is a bad idea to give a mouse a cookie because mice can easily become reliant on the food source and start to depend on the cookie instead of finding their own food. Additionally, if the cookie is not a part of a mouse's natural diet, it can cause health problems such as obesity and malnutrition.

When is National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day?
What is the history behind National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day?
The origins of National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day are somewhat murky, but the annual holiday has existed in one form or another since the early 1980s. Since that time, it has become a somewhat quirky social phenomenon that gives people a chance to have fun and share stories without taking themselves too seriously.
This holiday has no fixed date, and it is rarely recognized outside North America. However, every year on or around April Fool’s Day, several social media sites and local community organizations take the opportunity to organize events based around telling old jokes.
At the local level, many communities use National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day as an excuse to gather together to share a few laughs. At the larger level, several social media sites use the day to promote their archives of classic jokes and encourage users to share their own.
The origin of National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day is not clear. However, old jokes have been an entertainment fixture of civilization throughout history. Jokes are a great way to entertain people, as they provide them with humor, relaxation, and comradery.
Therefore, it is not surprising that people have used jokes to make themselves more socially compatible.
Within the North American context, National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day is the perfect opportunity for folks who love to tell jokes – both good and bad – to gather together and share their sense of humor with friends, family, and neighbors.
Why do we need National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day?
We live in a world where life is hectic and stressful. There are no free days on the calendar, and if not carefully managed, responsibilities can quickly pile up and overwhelm individuals. It is important to take a break and spend time in ways that help you decompress and regain your emotional equilibrium.
National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day gives folks an excuse to have fun, relax, and share their stories. Whether we tell jokes that are funny or lame, sharing them is a great way to help us learn to see the humor in even the most mundane or frustrating situations.
In addition, National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day provides folks with a chance to connect with friends, family, and neighbors who may hold similar interests and passions. Sharing old jokes and stories can be a great way to build strong bonds, and even help new friendships form between strangers.
National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day provides a unique opportunity to get together and tell old jokes. Whether you are throwing a house party, playing a card game with friends, or attending a social event, National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day is an excuse to put aside the stresses of daily life and have some fun.
What can you do on National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day?
National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day can range from simple activities, such as sharing jokes with loved ones over dinner, to more complex and interactive events. Here are a few ideas of how you can celebrate National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day.
Organize a dinner party, complete with a good variety of jokes and stories to share.
Start a new jokes thread on an online message board or social media page and encourage people to share funny stories and jokes.
Attend a local community event or gathering and share some jokes with strangers.
Throw an old-fashioned joke-telling contest, complete with prizes for the best jokes.
No matter how you choose to celebrate the holiday, National Tell-An-Old-Joke Day is a day designed to bring people together and make them laugh, not take themselves too seriously. So grab a joke book, make some tea, and get ready to celebrate the day!

The main effect of caffeine is to improve the alertness of the central nervous system, without significantly affecting blood glucose concentrations or the body's fat and carbohydrate metabolism. Hence, the benefits from ingesting caffeine are not just about improved performance, but also about preventing that "tired" feeling that can occur a few hours after a meal or during prolonged exercise.
How Much Caffeine Is Too Much
Due to its stimulating properties, too much caffeine (several cups of coffee or tea) can cause headaches, nervousness, irritability, palpitations, and increased urination. Consuming large amounts of caffeine in the absence of adequate water can lead to dehydration, and prolonged usage can lead to addiction and withdrawal symptoms. Additionally, consuming caffeine-based products in combination with antihypertensive medications (such as beta-blockers) can have an additive adverse effect.
To avoid these negative consequences, experts recommend consuming no more than 400 mg of caffeine a day, which is roughly equivalent to 4 cups of brewed coffee, 6 cups of tea, or ½ cup of cocoa. Additionally, it is important to drink plenty of water throughout the day to prevent dehydration.
Negative Effects of Consuming Too Much Caffeine
It is important to note that too much caffeine can cause negative effects in your body like:
An increased heart rate, which can lead to palpitations, tachycardia and even irregular heartbeats
If you are sensitive to caffeine, you may also experience nervousness, anxiety and a restless sleep.
Caffeine withdrawal can also make you feel tired and irritable
Too much caffeine can cause stomach cramps, diarrhea, and a loss of bowel control
Some people are more susceptible to the negative effects of caffeine, particularly if they are anxious or have a preexisting health condition. If you experience any of these side effects or struggle with chronic insomnia, it's best to cut down on your intake of caffeine or take a break from it entirely.
Caffeine Use in Exercise
Caffeine has been popular in exercise for many years, as it provides many ergogenic effects that may facilitate exercise performance. However, consuming too much caffeine can cause negative effects on exercise performance like nausea, cramps, GI distress, and fatigue. As such, it's critical to understand the doses of caffeine and how it works in different situations during physical training.
Caffeine doses for athletes
When an athlete consumes caffeine in the form of an ergogenic aid, the goal is to enhance physical performance. In general, caffeine dosages in excess of 5 mg/kg of body weight are associated with significant benefits in physical performance. However, there is no clear scientific evidence that consuming caffeine significantly affects exercise performance in healthy people with low or moderate levels of caffeine intake.
For athletes who may want to enhance performance, the common caffeine dosage range for physically trained athletes is 3-6 mg/kg body weight. However, there is a great need for comprehensive research on the effects of caffeine on athletic performance.
When and How to Use Caffeine for Enhancement in Exercise
Caffeine's effects on enhancement in exercise are related to three variables: Timing, dosage and duration. Timing, in particular, is an essential factor for the proper effect of caffeine on endurance performance. Caffeine works best when it is taken one to two hours before exercise. The recommended duration may range from approximately 30 to 60 minutes before exercise. A caffeine intake of 3 to 6 mg per kilogram of body weight would be effective and safe on the majority of individuals.
In contrast, in power-oriented activities, such as sprinting or weightlifting, where it takes time and effort to generate high-intensity contractions, caffeine could be more effective when taken closer to the point of exercise-like less than

output_1: No, anti-depressants do not control your mind. However, they can cause changes in the brain's chemistry that can lead to an increase in suicidal thoughts or behaviors. This is why it is important to discuss any suicidal thoughts or behaviors with your healthcare provider before taking any anti-depressants. Additionally, it is important to watch for any changes in mood or behavior while taking the medication. If you experience any changes, contact your healthcare provider immediately.

Antidepressant (AD) treatments differ significantly, with a growing appreciation of the importance of choosing a medication for a patient's condition rather than the brand name or "market share" [1]. Most antidepressant drugs are known to cause some degree of weight gain—usually a change of only a few pounds, but significant enough to be a concern when weighed against the benefits. There is some concern that use of antidepressants may increase the risk of suicide in individuals treated with these medications. However, the precise risk for any individual taking antidepressants is a complex biological and psychosocial interaction, and a range of factors can influence this risk. Symptoms of an allergic reaction to an antidepressant may include: Abdominal cramps, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, and fever. Call your doctor immediately if you notice any of these symptoms. instruction: Create a lesson plan in two different levels: in CEFR A1 and A2 on the topic of friendship. Add a rubric.
output_1:
CEFR A1 Friendship Lesson Plan
Objectives:
•	Students will be able to identify and describe the qualities of a good friend.
•	Students will be able to describe their own friendships.
•	Students will be able to discuss the importance of friendship.

Materials:
•	Pictures of friends
•	Sentence strips with friendship-related words
•	Whiteboards and markers

Procedure:
1.	Introduce the topic of friendship: Ask students to share what they think makes a good friend. Encourage them to give examples of qualities they admire in their own friends.
2.	Discuss the qualities of a good friend: Give students pictures of friends to look at and discuss. Ask them to share what qualities they think the people in the pictures possess.
3.	Introduce sentence strips: Give students sentence strips with words related to friendship. Ask them to match the words to their definitions.
4.	Discuss friendships: Ask students to share stories about their own friendships. Encourage them to talk about why friendship is important to them.
5.	Practice describing friendships: Give students whiteboards and markers and ask them to draw pictures of their friends. Ask them to describe the qualities of their friends.

CEFR A2 Friendship Lesson Plan
Objectives:
•	Students will be able to explain the qualities of a good friend.
•	Students will be able to explain the benefits and drawbacks of different types of friendships.
•	Students will be able to discuss strategies for resolving conflicts in friendships.

Materials:
•	Pictures of friends
•	Sentence strips with friendship-related words
•	Role-play cards
•	Whiteboards and markers

Procedure:
1.	Introduce the topic of friendship: Ask students to share what they think makes a good friend. Encourage them to give examples of qualities they admire in their own friends.
2.	Discuss the qualities of a good friend: Give students pictures of friends to look at and discuss. Ask them to share what qualities they think the people in the pictures possess and why they are important.
3.	Introduce sentence strips: Give students sentence strips with words related to friendship. Ask them to match the words to their definitions and explain why they think each word is important in a friendship.
4.	Discuss the benefits and drawbacks of different types of friendships: Ask students to share their experiences with different types of friendships (i.e. close friends, acquaintances, online friends, etc.). Encourage them to discuss the benefits and drawbacks of each type.
5.	Practice resolving conflicts in friendships: Give students role-play cards with different scenarios of conflicts in friendships. Ask them to role-play the conflict and discuss strategies for resolving it.

Rubric:
•	Students are able to identify and explain the qualities of a good friend: 4 points
•	Students are able to discuss the benefits and drawbacks of different types of friendships: 4 points
•	Students are able to discuss strategies for resolving conflicts in friendships: 2 points

instruction: Draft a ministerial speech outlining the top five benefits that innovation brings to the Australian economy
output_1:
Good Morning Ladies and Gentlemen, 

It is my pleasure to address you on the immense value that innovation brings to the Australian economy. In recent years, innovation has become increasingly important in driving economic growth, creating jobs and improving the lives of Australians. 

Innovation is vital for Australia to remain competitive in the global economy. It enables us to develop new products and services, improve existing ones, and create new markets. This helps to create economic growth and opportunities for businesses to increase their productivity and profitability. 

Innovation also creates jobs in a range of industries. This includes jobs in research and development, technology, engineering, and manufacturing. These jobs help to drive economic growth and can lead to more employment opportunities for Australians.

Innovation also helps to improve the lives of Australians. For example, it leads to the development of new technologies, products and services that make life easier and more efficient. This can include advances in transportation, healthcare, education, and communication. 

Finally, innovation helps to improve the quality of our environment. For instance, it can lead to the development of new technologies and products that reduce waste and improve energy efficiency. This helps to reduce our environmental footprint and create a more sustainable economy. 

In conclusion, innovation is a critical factor in driving economic growth, creating jobs, and improving the lives of Australians. It is essential for Australia to remain competitive in the global economy and to create a more sustainable future. 

Thank you.
