Gift giving can be a tedious task, especially when you need to do it quickly. But being last minute doesn't have to mean a bland gift. Here are three gift ideas that will make someone's holiday extra special.

Title 2: Three Last-Minute Holiday Gift Ideas

1. Personalized Candle

A personalized candle is a great option for a gift. The recipient gets something that reflects their taste and is uniquely personalized just for them. Giving the gift of light and fragrance and making it even more special.

Example: "Joe has always had a thing for strong candles, and you know the perfect one for him — with his favorite scent". Add something unique about this item.

2. Unique Christmas Decoration

3. Personalized Photo Frame

This is a good option for a gift that has sentimental value and reflects personal interests or hobbies. The recipient gets a customized and personalized photo frame that has been handmade and engraved with a unique message.

These are three last-minute gift ideas that will make your holiday extra special. With a little bit of thought and planning, you can avoid those last-minute dashes to the mall, and the feeling of frustration.

instruction:
Write a section for a blog post and try to cover all of the provided information about this section in your text.

Blog Topic: 7 Fall Fashion Trends Worth Taking on Your Trip
Section Title: Trusty Jeans
Main point of the section: jeans can be worn all year and look good with everything .
output_1:
No matter what the season, jeans are always a great option for fashion-savvy travelers. Jeans are versatile, comfortable, and can be dressed up or down to suit any occasion. This fall, trusty jeans are an absolute must-have for jet-setting style.

Jeans are an incredibly versatile wardrobe staple that look great with everything. Add a cozy sweater and some boots for a casual, yet stylish look that’s perfect for exploring new cities. Or, style them with a crisp white shirt and heels for a night out on the town. You can never go wrong with a classic pair of jeans.

Plus, jeans are incredibly comfortable and can be worn all year. From chilly autumn days to balmy summer nights, jeans can be dressed up or down to suit any climate. And, if you’re packing light, they’re the perfect item for making multiple outfits out of the same pieces.

So, when you’re planning your fall wardrobe for your next vacation, make sure you don’t forget a trusty pair of jeans. With their timeless style and endless versatility, they’ll have you looking chic no matter where your travels take you.

- Remember that everyone around you is probably just having a bad day, and it's not personal.
- Speak the language as much as you can - it shows respect and an effort to connect with locals.
- Always pack extra copies of important documents (like boarding passes or passports).

You should choose a YouTube video title based on the video's content. A video's title tells viewers what to expect from it. It should be direct, honest, and clear. The title of the video needs to capture the attention of viewers, so do not use an unclear or ambiguous one.

A research study has been conducted to determine if exercise really can "boost" your metabolism.
output_1: "Does Exercise Really 'Boost' Your Metabolism? A Research Study Reveals the Answer"
output_2:
You should choose a YouTube video title based on the video's content. A video's title tells viewers what to expect from it. It should be direct, honest, and clear. The title of the video needs to capture the attention of viewers, so do not use an unclear or ambiguous one.

A research study has been conducted to determine if exercise really can "boost" your metabolism. The findings showed that exercise does boost your metabolic rate, and that it can be an effective form of weight loss. Therefore, a video title that reads "Exercise Can Boost Your Metabolic Rate," is an appropriate title for that research study report. By selecting a descriptive title, you are giving viewers an idea of what they will find when they click on your video. Thus, it increases the likelihood of a click-through from YouTube.

Now, let's take the same video, and call it "Metabolism, Exercise, and Weight Loss." While the title is still relevant, it's not nearly as informative as the previous title. The issue here is that the video could really be on any number of topics, and the lack of specificity and descriptive language makes the title less useful for your audience.

Now let's take the title of the same video, "Exercise Can Boost Your Metabolic Rate." Then, let's make a more generic video title that is less relevant to the video content. The search volume of "Wordpress" is steadily growing at a rate of 18 percent every year. This research helped me select a keyword with high search volume and a low amount of competition. By doing this, I'm increasing the chances that people searching for specific information about "how to build a website" will find my video.

To create a good title, consider three main factors: clarity, relevance to the content, and search volume. Clarity refers to ensuring your title is clear and concise. Relevance should be based on the actual topic of your video. Consider using a keyword of search volume that is closely related to your topic. By choosing keywords with these strategies, your video is more likely to show up in searches, leading more viewers to your content.

The video title is one of the most important aspects of YouTube SEO. The research conducted will help to provide you with the right information to make an informed decision about your video title. In general, make sure that your videos are clear, concise, and well-optimized for viewers and YouTube.

1. Avoid names with negative or inappropriate connotation.

instruction:
Discuss the origins and history of the word that has been given to you.

oblique
output_1:
The origin of the word oblique dates back to the 15th century. It is derived from the Latin obliquus, meaning “slanting” or “not perpendicular”. Over time, the term has come to be associated with anything that is angled or slanted in some way.

The first recorded use of the word oblique in English was in the mid-15th century. It was initially used to describe angles or lines that were not perpendicular, or in other words, slanted. However, it soon began to be used more broadly to describe anything that was not straight or direct. This could include objects, thoughts, or even emotions.

Oblique has come to be associated with words like indirect and devious. It is often used to describe people or ideas that are not straightforward or honest. It can also be used to refer to something that is not as it appears, such as an oblique reference or an oblique comment.

In modern usage, the word oblique is still used to describe anything that is slanted or angled. It is also used to describe people or ideas that are not straightforward or honest.
output_2:
Discuss the origins and history of the word that has been given to you.

oblique, a. Shown by an oblique line or angle, slanting.

The word oblique comes from the Latin word obliquus, which means "slanted". Oblique has been in use in English since the mid-fourteenth century, as a synonym of oblique, which means "slanted", "oblique", or "at an angle". Oblique is now usually only used in specialized contexts in mathematics and geometry, where it usually has a precise and technical meaning that is distinct from its everyday sense.

Oblique's etymology is probably related to the Latin verb obliquus, or, "bent, twisted". The word's use was widespread in ancient Greece, where it meant "deformed, disfigured."

The notion of oblique has been present in many different cultures across the globe. In the ancient times, in art, the position of the eyes and the head, as well as the poses were highly regarded from Greek artists, to Persian and Egyptian painting. These artists incorporated and emphasized the notion of "oblique" in their artwork, where the perspective of the artist and the viewer is considered.

In modern day art, the concept of oblique has been utilized in many art movements. Surrealism, for instance, was a movement that incorporated objects and ideas that were unconventional and "oblique" - an art movement that used techniques to create dreamlike imagery that allowed for the subconscious to reveal itself.

Oblique has also been used in modern psychology and cognitive science to refer to a type of perception or cognition that is not oriented in a direct or linear fashion. Oblique views or ideas, for instance, can be thought of as those that are not directly in line with a particular person's worldview or experience.

The notion of oblique has also been present in politics and media. During the Cold War, for instance, U.S. officials would often refer to Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev as being "oblique," suggesting that Khrushchev's foreign policy and rhetoric were ambiguous and difficult to understand or predict.

The concept of "oblique" has also been discussed in linguistics, where it is understood as a form of language that deviates from grammatical norms, usually for stylistic reasons. In literary theory, for instance, oblique language is seen as a way of conveying emotion or ideas through metaphors and figurative language.

From the mid-fourteenth to now oblique has evolved and acquired a specific definition, conveying a notion of deviation or disarray. Moreover, the concept that oblique has become part of different cultures, and has been incorporated in psychology, sociology, linguistics among various other disciplines. By researching the origins and history of the word, I discovered an interesting aspect about oblique, how the notion has been incorporated across different disciplines and its importance in today's society.

## 2. Contrast the word oblique with a word or phrase of equal meaning and weight that illustrates the difference between the two.

In this case, contrasting word could be the word "straight" or "straightforward."

Straight, a, adj. Direct, perpendicular, or parallel, as in a line or road.

Straight is an antonym to oblique, as the meaning of straight is that it is not at an angle. This is especially clear with the case of a line or a road, where a straight line represents a direct line or a road without obstacles.

As opposed to the word oblique, meaning at an angle, the word straight represents a direct, perpendicular or parallel. The concept of straight represents simplicity, which means that it follows the line without variations or interruptions. As stated before, the word oblique implies complexity, which implies that the straight line becomes irregular when we approach the subject matter.

Moreover, the word straight does not have specific cultural influences. In mathematics, for instance, the concept of "right angle" does not have any cultural influence on other cultures in the world. In society, people might have an understanding of the concept right angles and the concept of the lines being straight. However, the word itself is not deeply influenced by any cultural value or system of thoughts.

Straight has been used in many linguistic contexts and its meaning can vary among individuals. For instance, many people use the word straight as a way to describe an attitude, mind-set, or behavior that is ethical,

instruction:
A confirmation email should be written appropriately for the situation.

A meeting has been scheduled, and the sender expects the other to review the slides.
output_1:
Subject: Meeting Confirmation

Dear [Name],

I am writing to confirm our upcoming meeting scheduled for [date] at [time].

I have attached the slides that we will be discussing for your review. Please let me know if you have any questions or need any clarification.

I look forward to seeing you at the meeting.

Best,
[Your Name]
output_2:
A confirmation email should be written appropriately for the situation.

A meeting has been scheduled, and the sender expects the other to review the slides. So, a friendly, "Thanks for meeting me, I'll be looking forward to the discussion." will suffice.

However, it's worth keeping in mind that emails shouldn't be too long. A sentence or two is fine, but a paragraph or two might be overkill.

This is why people recommend the "Thanks" approach. It's short enough to be concise, but it also lets the receiver know that the e-mail has been received and read.

However, if you feel a little more explanation would help you feel more comfortable, why not throw in something like, "I hope to have a lively, interactive conversation with you." or "I look forward to discussing ways we can work together."

Just be sure to keep it short and to the point. Nothing will turn off your reader faster than an unwieldy, cluttered email.

Answer: For me, it all depends on what the tone of the email is. If you have a more formal tone to the email, then it would be best manners to say thank you for reading it (whether the reader actually got through the email or not is a different question).

If you have a more colloquial tone, then perhaps saying "See you soon" or something like that would make more sense. Again, it really depends on the context of the email. The more informal nature of email communication allows for flexibility in terms of how we address the sender.

So, all in all, the email closing could make a difference between making the receiver feel like they are appreciated or just being a jerk.

instruction: You need to write an email to negotiate your salary.
output_1:
Dear [Employer],

I am writing to you regarding my current salary. I am very grateful for the opportunity you have given me and the salary that I am currently receiving. However, I strongly believe that I am capable of contributing more to the team and I am confident that my current salary does not reflect the value of my contributions.

I understand that it is not easy to increase the salary for one employee, but I would like to discuss the possibility of increasing my salary to a more appropriate amount. I can provide you with examples of my achievements and the value I bring to the team.

I hope that you will consider my request and look forward to hearing your thoughts on this matter.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
output_2:
You need to write an email to negotiate your salary. Read More . But you need to ask yourself if it’s financially worth it to you. If money is a big motivator for you, and you want to increase your compensation or ensure a high-paying job, investing the time to understand what companies are looking for is worth it.
How to Know if You’re Ready to Start
If you haven’t spent much time thinking about what you want out of your career, now may be a good time to start.
First, think about your core values and what motivates you in your career. What kind of work environment do you thrive in? What kind of culture do you want to work with? What goals do you have personally and professionally that you would like to achieve? If you have some idea of your values and what you are looking for, it’s easy to begin to identify opportunities that will align with your goals. And, you will likely have a better idea of what’s worth spending time on.
Next, keep an open mind. Many people overlook opportunities, only to realize later they were right for them but didn’t act on them. Maybe you had your heart set on a certain job, but it just didn’t work out. This doesn’t mean you’re not on the right path. It means you haven’t found the right opportunity yet.
Take advantage of networking, job boards, and social media. This is where you can get a sense of what’s out there and what kinds of opportunities are best suited for you. Start with targeted research, and then reach out to contacts — both personal and professional — to expand your network.
You could also consider seeking out a mentor or a career coach. These people can help you with career goals, skill development, and can guide you through the process.
If you’re not sure about where to start, there are plenty of resources online. Check out our career section for helpful articles on skills, industry trends, and more. You can find job listings (both local and remote) on websites like Glassdoor, Indeed, and LinkedIn.
And don’t forget to take time for yourself. It’s important to be in good physical and mental health. You’ll be better able to focus and be productive when you take your well-being seriously. Exercise, meditation, and relaxation techniques can all help you feel better.
Making a career jump is a big decision, but it doesn’t have to be overwhelming. Use the tips above and start looking for opportunities that align with your values and goals. With time and effort, you can find the path that’s right for you.
Image Credit: Lena Hapgood on Unsplash

Send an email to all attendees of the event the day before the event to remind them and to ask if they have any last-minute questions.
Create an event page on Facebook or LinkedIn that includes an event description, location, and when to call if they should not be able to attend on the day.
Send a group text to attendees 1 hour or less before the event begins, reminding them to arrive on time and to be ready to start.
Be Prepared For Changes or Delays
Be prepared for any changes in schedule, rooms, or anything that would cause an issue on the day.
Have a backup plan in case the conference is moved to a new location or has to be altered due to circumstances beyond your control.
Be Aware of Your Atmosphere
Be aware of the atmosphere of the event you organize. If it is too formal, you may not attract many attendees, while if it is too casual, attendees might not feel like they are getting anything out of the event.
Make it an enjoyable experience for participants – this might mean having refreshments or breaks during the day, or ensuring that the facilities are suitable for everyone’s needs.
Make Attendees Comfortable
It’s really important to make sure that all attendees are given a warm welcome, and that they feel comfortable being there.
You can facilitate this by addressing everyone and making sure that everyone feels they are part of the event.
By following these tips, you will be able to organize an event that runs smoothly, and that all participants enjoy.
This can lead to an event that people are excited to attend, and gives you the opportunity to demonstrate your skills and abilities to potential employers, sponsors or future clients.

What Are The Most Important Social Media Marketing Strategies That Can Help You Attract More Customers?
As a small business owner, you know firsthand just how challenging it can be to compete in today’s digital world.
With numerous competitors vying for the same customer, it’s no wonder that social media marketing is a crucial part of any business plan.
Social media is not only a great way to connect with potential customers, but it’s also an excellent way to promote your services, products, and brand.
However, just because social media marketing can help improve your business, it doesn’t necessarily mean that you can jump into the social media marketing trenches and expect immediate results.
Understanding what the most important social media marketing strategies are will help you get a better return on your investment.
Here are what we consider to be the most essential social media marketing strategies that can help you attract more customers:
Plan Your Social Media Strategy
Before you begin implementing social media marketing strategies, it’s crucial that you have a clear, comprehensive and specific social media strategy in place.
Your social media strategy should outline what you want to achieve from your social media campaign and how you’re going to do it.
Your social media strategy must be specific, detailed, and measurable so that you can measure your progress and achieve your goals.
Define Your Social Media Goals
Understanding your company’s goals is essential before you begin executing your social media marketing.
Defining your social media goals will help you determine which social media channels to use, which types of content to create and how you’ll measure the success of your efforts.
Determine your social media objectives, such as increasing brand awareness, driving traffic to your website, nurturing lead generation and generating more sales.
Ensure You Have a Consistent Visual Identity
Your social media presence should be as much of an extension of your brand as your website.
Ensure that your posts and visual content remain consistent across all your social media channels to create a seamless brand identity.
Your branding should stand out but also fit with the theme of the platform.
Use the Platforms That Are Trending in Your Business Niche
Before you begin planning your social media strategy, you should research and identify which platforms will best serve your business goals.
You’ll need to identify the platforms that are trending in your business niche as well as understand the user demographics and culture of each audience.

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output_1:
1. Log into your GitHub account.

2. Go to the repository where the conflict is occurring and select the “Pull Requests” tab.

3. Find the pull request with the merge conflict and click on it.

4. In the pull request, select the “Files changed” tab.

5. In the “Files changed” tab, select the “Conversation” tab to view the conflict.

6. In the “Conversation” tab, you should see the conflict indicated by a red exclamation mark (!) and a line of code with two conflicting changes.

7. Carefully review the conflicting changes and decide which change you want to keep and which change you want to discard.

8. Once you have decided which change to keep, delete the change you want to discard.

9. Commit your changes and push them to the repository.

10. Once the changes have been pushed, open the pull request again.

11. On the pull request page, select the “Merge pull request” button.

12. If the merge is successful, the merge conflict should be resolved.

instruction:
One or more jobs can be run automatically by a workflow. The workflows are defined in the repository as YAML files and will run if an event occurs in the repository, as well as manually, or on a certain schedule.
Bring an example of a workflow that demonstrate the CI/CD features of GitHub Actions.
output_1:
name: CI/CD Workflow

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Build
        run: |
          npm install
          npm run build
      - name: Test
        run: |
          npm run test
      - name: Deploy
        run: |
          npm run deploy
output_2:
One or more jobs can be run automatically by a workflow. The workflows are defined in the repository as YAML files and will run if an event occurs in the repository, as well as manually, or on a certain schedule.
Bring an example of a workflow that demonstrate the CI/CD features of GitHub Actions.
github actions is a set of tools that let you control the workload of your project, from simple tasks such as running a linter, to sophisticated workflows that can deploy code to production, all through a web interface or the command line. You can even build and deploy your applications on multiple platforms including Windows, macOS and Linux, and deploy to cloud-based services such as AWS Elastic Beanstalk or Microsoft Azure.
To run an action in a workspace, you can either execute it manually from the web UI or call it from a code task. The two basic options are:
Use GitHub Actions’ built-in web UI to execute actions by typing in the name of the action or clicking on the "Run" button in the sidebar. This is the quickest and easiest way to start using GitHub Actions but it limits you to the actions that GitHub Actions provides.
Use the GitHub API to call any action directly. For example, you might create a build script that calls the "deploy" action on a specific repository. Or, if you want to use the same technique for multiple actions, you could create a batch file or script that calls several actions in sequence.
In GitHub Actions, what is a webhook?
A webhook is an external function that will receive notifications from GitHub when something happens: users post comments on a repository, PRs are received, repositories are updated, or other events. This means that you can create webhooks and configure them to fire off actions whenever something happens in a repository. You create the webhooks using a webhook.yml file in the repository.
What is the purpose of GitHub Actions on a project?
The purpose of GitHub Actions is to automate repetitive tasks, reduce mistakes, and simplify processes. This allows developers to focus on creating quality code, which in turn increases productivity. To achieve this, GitHub Actions implements workflows, which are scripts created by developers that perform tasks like deploying code to a server or running the linter. The developers can then configure these workflows to run whenever a specific event occurs, based on their needs.
In GitHub Actions, what is a workflow?
Workflows are sequences of actions that developers can use to automate different tasks. Workflows are implemented as YAML files located in the repository. Each workflow has a set of actions defined inside it and when certain events occur based on the repository, the workflow executes the actions in a specific order. GitHub workflows let you automate a variety of tasks like deploying code to production or running a test suite.
In GitHub Actions, what is a webhook?
A webhook is a notification hook on GitHub. Developers use webhooks to trigger GitHub Actions, enabling a wide range of tasks to be automated. A webhook can be created by a developer and then sent to any GitHub event, such as a repository being updated or a new commit being pushed to the repository. Once those events occur, the webhook is triggered, and GitHub Actions is called to execute whatever actions you've configured with it.
Given an example of setting up a workflow with GitHub Actions, what would the workflow script look like?
In this example, we'll start with a simple workflow that's triggered after every commit to the repository. To do this, we can add a section to the repository's .gitignore file that will exclude the workflow script and its dependencies from being pushed or checked in.
When a new commit is done, GitHub will trigger the workflow if a .gitignore file exists in the repository. Once this trigger happens, the workflow will start executing. Inside the workflow yml file, you can list a series of nested tasks that will execute one after the other.
The workflow script looks like this:
name: Run the linters
- echo Running the linters ...
- git lint ..
- exitCode 0 # or 1 if linters failed?
If you want, you can use variables in the workflow script to customize the task for different circumstances, and if you're using Node.js, you can use npm modules to install dependencies, as shown in the example below:
name: Deploy to API
on: [push, pull_request, issue_comment, issue_event]
- echo Deploying code to API ...
- mongolab api token
mongolab $apiToken
- cd ..
- npm install bcrypt npm install mongoose -g
mongoose $m

The movie tagline is the film's advertising slogan, usually printed on posters prior to the official release. It is a short description or comment on a movie to capture the essence of the movie, and ultimately make you watch the movie. Here is an example:

Movie: Joker (2019)
output_1: "Put on a Happy Face."

The movie tagline is the film's advertising slogan, usually printed on posters prior to the official release. It is a short description or comment on a movie to capture the essence of the movie, and ultimately make you watch the movie. Here is an example:

Movie: Joker (2019)
Tagline: In a world where you can't rely on anyone, not even yourself...

Movie: The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
Tagline: No, please, the hope chest of memories... it belonged to her mother...

### Opening credits

The movie opening credits are the names of actors and crew members who worked on the film that appear on the beginning of the movie. They show a visual of the film's title or a dramatic scene, before moving to credits. 

Here is an example:

Movie: The Wizard of Oz (1939)
Opening Credits:
Produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
Written by Noel Langley
Based on the novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum
Directed by Victor Fleming
Starring Judy Garland, Frank Morgan, and Bert Lahr, among others

### Prologue

A prologue is an opening sequence to introduce the viewer to the characters and setting. It establishes the tone and mood of the film. Prologues may be flashbacks, dream sequences or flashforwards and provide an essential piece of information to understand the plot.

Here is an example of a prologue scene from a movie:

Movie: Gladiator (2000)
Prologue:
Audience- The Prologue of Gladiator sets the stage for the main story, it reveals General Maximus's tragic childhood, and his relationship with his family, then he joins in the glory and prosperity of Rome then betrayed by the Emperor. 

### Acts

In the majority of movies, acts are arranged into a narrative structure, with each act having an emphasis on a different type of story element. Acts are divided into scenes, which make up the larger narrative of the film. The first act of a film is often devoted to introducing the protagonist, establishing the initial setting and the primary problem, and introducing major characters; the second act of a film is usually occupied with escalating or complicating the problem, often introducing additional characters and subplots, and gradually revealing more about the protagonist; the third act of a film is often devoted to resolving the primary problem that has been established throughout the film, and providing a satisfying conclusion that brings everything together.

### Sequences

Sequences are groupings of shots or takes that contribute to the narrative structure of a film. Each sequence might have a particular mood or visual motif to establish a particular style or setting. Sequences might be long or short, and might have a particular function, such as an action sequence, a scene of dialogue or a scene depicting important internal thoughts.

Here is an example:

Movie: The Godfather (1972)
Sequence: The opening of the Godfather is a sequence that introduces the mafia family which is the central focus of the film. 

The Godfather introduces the Don, Michael Corleone, who is the protagonist of the film, but also includes the family of Michael. The sequence opens with Michael (Pacino) being taken to a dinner party to meet with the heads of New York's five families, a significant step in establishing Michael as a member of the mafia. The camera switches between shots of the men at the table who are judging Michael and his family.

To add to the sequence, the director uses the shots to establish the power of the family, which gives the sense of the danger Michael could be in, and to show the character's struggle to fit into the mafia's expectations. The sequence emphasizes the characters and their relationships. It shows how power, money, and crime are intertwined. And finally, the scene shows the audience the family's influence, power, and fear through the various characters who attend.

### Scenes

Each scene builds on an individual event that advances the film's plot. Unlike the scenes in a play, each movie scene should not be regarded as a self-contained unit. In fact, each scene in a movie can have its own subplots running through it, or it can be a scene that advances a main

You are given some reviews for a movie. Each video might have mentioned some negative or positive points about the movie. Read them carefully and extract the positive and negative points mentioned in all of the reviews. Then, make a list of these points and summarize them as positive points and negative points.

Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. I have huge respect for the way this film was made but, much like The Matrix, I feel like people attach way more importance to this movie than it deserves.
Review 2: The film tells the story of men who cannot adapt to the social order in today's world, under the leadership of Tyler Durden, to discover their natural instinct, masculinity, and to escape from their unhappy lives.
Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.

- Doesn't end well.

instruction:
Give a brief summary of the movie or series' plot.

Breaking Bad (TV Series 2008–2013)
output_1: Breaking Bad follows the journey of Walter White, a high school chemistry teacher who is diagnosed with terminal cancer. Desperate to provide for his family, he turns to a life of crime, producing and selling meth with his former student Jesse Pinkman. Together they face a series of dangerous obstacles and life-threatening situations as they attempt to secure Walter's legacy.
output_2:
Give a brief summary of the movie or series' plot.

Breaking Bad (TV Series 2008–2013) is a critically acclaimed American crime drama series produced by Sony Pictures Television for AMC about Walter White (played by Bryan Cranston), a high school chemistry teacher who turns to producing and distributing Crystal Meth to pay for his family's medical bills. As his criminal empire grows, he becomes entangled in a web of corruption, betrayal, and the possibility of redemption.

HBO's True Detective (TV Mini-Series 2014) is a drama co-created by writers Nic Pizzolatto and David Milch and directed by Cary Joji Fukunaga. The series takes place across seven different timelines and three different eras in American history. It follows interconnected detective stories that are each set in different periods in time but are all inspired by the same Manson family-like cult.

## C

Criticism

Write a critique of the show and/or movie.

Breaking Bad is widely recognized as one of the finest dramas of its time. It garnered widespread acclaim from critics and fans alike, and is regularly cited as one of the greatest shows in television history. The series follows the rise and fall of Walter White, one of the most complex and captivating protagonists in television history, and his descent into the criminal underworld. The show is not only exceptional in its writing, but also its directing, and its complex and nuanced exploration of criminal activity and its moral implications. Breaking Bad features excellent performances across the board, particularly from leading actor Bryan Cranston, who won four Emmys for his role, and from Anna Gunn and Giancarlo Esposito as his wife and partner, respectively. The show's writing is both tight and expansive, exploring the many layers of the story and its characters with great nuance and skill. From its opening minutes, it is clear that Breaking Bad is a show unlike anything that had come before it, and it remains both entertaining and thought-provoking more than a decade later.

Conclusion/recommendation

Given the show's outstanding performances, writing, and direction, and its importance to modern television, Breaking Bad is highly recommended.

True Detective (TV Mini-Series 2014) is another critically acclaimed show that has enjoyed immense popularity. The show follows three detectives—played by Matthew McConaughey, Woody Harrelson and Colin Farrell—as they investigate a bizarre, ritualistic murder over three different time periods. The show is gripping, dark, and unnerving, and the performances are stellar across the board. The writing is equally compelling, with a complex and multilayered narrative that explores issues of masculinity, violence, and politics.

Considering the show's remarkable direction, writing, and performances, True Detective is highly recommended.

Citation

Goldberg, M. (2013). 'Breaking Bad' Season 5 Finale Gets Cable Ratings Record. Retrieved from: http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/breaking-bad-season-5-finale-gets-477300

## D

Dialogue and analysis

In the world of the Breaking Bad series, Walter White (Bryan Cranston) is a chemistry teacher who discovers he has terminal cancer. In an effort to provide for his family, he produces and sells crystal meth to other drug dealers. Dialogue in the show involves drug dealers and the effects they have on those around them. One character, Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul), is a student of White's and is forced to work with him in the drug business. The two character's interactions reveal how different approaches to the same situation can lead to disaster.

The dialogue in the True Detective series (TV Mini-Series 2014) often consists of cops discussing their cases and the challenges they face. The series follows different detectives as they investigate a ritualistic murder and uncover a conspiracy involving a secret society and the occult. The dialogue between the detectives and those they interview reveals the characters' personalities and their motivations. The series utilizes a non-linear narrative, allowing viewers to see all three time periods through the eyes of individual characters.

Discussion/analysis

instruction:
Write a short analysis of the cinematography in the movie.

Dead Poets Society
output_1: The cinematography in Dead Poets Society is truly remarkable. It captures the beauty of the landscapes, the quaintness of the school campus, and the emotion of the characters. It utilizes the power of the wide-angle lens to create a sense of grandeur and awe as the characters explore their surroundings. The depth of field is also used to great effect, with the camera often focusing on a specific person or object while the background remains blurred. The color palette is warm and inviting, which gives the movie a sense of nostalgia. The lighting is used to great effect to create a moody atmosphere – it is especially effective in scenes that take place at night or in dimly lit rooms. All in all, the cinematography in Dead Poets Society is effective in creating an engaging and powerful visual experience.
output_2:
Write a short analysis of the cinematography in the movie.

Dead Poets Society Film Critique

In the film, we see a montage of scenes that follow the boys as they attend the school that they will ultimately graduate from. Through these scenes, we see them interact socially with one another as they make jokes and laugh at each other's silly antics. As the film progresses, we see them studying in class, preparing to take their exams, and we see them learn about the works of various poets. Through these scenes, the cinematography sets the mood that is established by the plot. The cinematography in the film Dead Poets Society was impressive in a way that it can only be described as unique. This film does not depend on stylized shooting or special effects to set a mood but rather it uses the camera to explore the world around it and express a world that it is not. This approach results in a vibrant and intense visual experience. Dead Poets Society tells the story of a group of boys at a prestigious boarding school that are introduced to a new teacher, played by Robin William's, who encourages them in defiance of the traditions of the school and challenges them to think for themselves. The visuals of the film set a mood that is unsettling yet engaging. We see a montage of shots that follow the boys as they interact with one another. In this montage, we see them smile, laugh, flirt, and joke as the camera moves among them. Overall, the cinematography in Dead Poets Society is excellent in that it effectively creates a mood that suits the tone of the film.

instruction:
Consider the best time of year to visit the given city, and provide your reasons for choosing that time.

Sydney, Australia
output_1: The best time of year to visit Sydney, Australia is during the fall, from March to May. During this time of year, the temperatures are mild and the skies are sunny, making it the perfect time for sightseeing. Additionally, the fall season in Sydney offers many outdoor activities such as whale watching, beach visits, and kayaking. There are also plenty of festivals and events to take part in. Furthermore, the fall season is generally the shoulder season in Sydney, which means there are fewer crowds and better prices for accommodations.
output_2:
Consider the best time of year to visit the given city, and provide your reasons for choosing that time.

Sydney, Australia is the best time of year to visit. November to February is the best time to visit, especially in the summer months. During this period, weather is quite ideal, and a lot of tourist attraction is accessible. The temperature in Sydney is perfect, around 20-32C (68-90F); it is neither too hot nor too cold. The ocean water temperature is also at a comfortable level for swimming and surfing. The beach, harbour, and parks are alive during this period. All the tourist attractions are open and crowded, with thousands of people, as the city prepares for its largest festival, the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, which runs for two weeks. The summer months are also school holiday periods, so a lot of families visit the city. The weather is not too unpleasant; during these months the humidity levels are low, so the air is not too oppressive.

Additional information to support your reasoning must be provided. Sydney has one of the most temperate climates in Australia. The city has a pleasant subtropical climate, characterised by warm summers and mild winters. With around 900 hours of sunshine per year, it attracts many travellers from around the globe. But the question is, which is the best time of year to visit this amazing city? The answer is not straightforward due to the varying temperatures that Sydney experiences throughout the year.

With regards to the weather, the city has average temperatures ranging from 13'C (55'F) to 28'C (82'F) throughout the year, making it conducive to enjoy all its activities and attractions. However, the best time to visit Sydney depends on personal preferences, as every season comes with its unique features. Summer is the most popular time to visit Sydney from December to February, but it’s also the busiest season, with many hotels and attractions booked out months in advance. The temperatures in Sydney during the summer season are normally around 13'C to 28'C (55'F to 82'F).

Fall, from April to June, is the autumn season in Sydney. The temperatures can range from 14'C to 27'C (57'F to 81'F), and the humidity level begins to drop gradually. The city turns into a great destination to enjoy its many outdoor festivals and events.

Spring, from September to November, offers some of Sydney’s best weather conditions. Temperatures range from 12'C to 25'C (54'F to 77'F). Sydney Spring Racing Carnival, one of the most exciting events in the city, runs from the end of September to approximately the first week of October. During this period, visitors from all over the world travel to Sydney to witness the horse racing action.

Winter, from June to August, is Sydney’s coldest season with average temperatures between 8 'C (46'F) and 20 'C (68'F). Winter is perfect for sightseeing, shopping, and getting a comfortable overnight stay when most tourists have left. It's not recommended to swim in the ocean during winter because it’s cold and the beaches are typically empty.

Therefore, November to February is the best time to visit Sydney, where you will experience ideal weather, low humidity, and plenty of attractions to visit and enjoy all that Sydney has to offer.

instruction: Name the top cities in France that should not be missed. Include the best aspects of each place as well.
output_1:
1. Paris: This iconic city is known for its grandiose monuments like the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame Cathedral, and the Louvre Museum. It is also home to a vibrant culinary and cultural scene, with plenty of restaurants, cafes, and museums to explore.

2. Marseille: This bustling port city is the oldest city in France and is home to some stunning architecture and a rich history. Explore the Old Port, check out the Basilica of Notre Dame de la Garde, and take in the views from the Calanques cliffs.

3. Nice: This beautiful city on the French Riviera is a great spot for beach-goers and those looking to explore some of the French Riviera's best-known attractions. Enjoy the Promenade des Anglais, the Cours Saleya market, and the numerous art galleries.

4. Lyon: This city is known as the gastronomic capital of France and is home to some of the country's best restaurants. Take in the stunning architecture and explore the many historic buildings like the Cathedral of St. John, the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière, and the Museum of Fine Arts.

5. Bordeaux: This city is famous for its wine and is host to some of the best vineyards in France. Take in the city's historic architecture, explore the city's many wine cellars, and enjoy the vibrant nightlife.

instruction:
Answer the following question.

How do I compare strings in Java?
I've been using the == operator in my program to compare all my strings so far. However, I ran into a bug, changed one of them into .equals() instead, and it fixed the bug.
Is == bad? When should it and should it not be used? What's the difference?
output_1: Using the == operator to compare strings in Java is not recommended. The == operator checks for object identity, not the contents of the strings. The .equals() method should be used to compare the contents of two strings instead. This method will return true if the two strings are equal in terms of the characters they contain.

Question2: I am learning how to use the threading and the multiprocessing modules in Python to run certain operations in parallel and speed up my code.

Comment: Is there some reason why your question needs to be split into two separate questions?  It's not clear why you couldn't ask both questions together.

Comment: @SethMMorton To have more specific attention when it comes to the answer. Also, one would be more straightforward to ask, the other more tricky. And I don't want to overwhelm the other by asking too many questions ;-)

Comment: This still looks like a two-part question to me.  Also, it's not clear what you mean by "when to use ... instead of ...".  My impression is that multiprocessing is better for general-purpose parallel programming while threading is better for tasks that may be cooperative or that can be easily split over multiple CPU cores.

Comment: I can't give you a comprehensive answer to your threading vs multiprocessing question -- that's too broad and depends on too many factors to cover in a single answer.  You'll need to research and experiment to find the answer that works best in your application.  You may start with the documentation I've linked to below, but I suggest looking up other resources and experimenting to get your own understanding.

Answer: \begin{blockquote}

Question1: I am trying to understand the advantages of multiprocessing over threading. I know that multiprocessing gets around the Global Interpreter Lock, but what other advantages are there, and can threading not do the same thing?
\end{blockquote}

A multiprocessing context (which is what the `multiprocessing` package offers) offers several advantages over threads:
\begin{itemize}
\item It works with any process that has the `multiprocessing` module installed.  This is useful for running parallel code on different OSes or machines.
\item It has a global interpreter lock. This means that each process that runs with the `multiprocessing` module installed can run in lock-step, with each process executing an identical sequence of operations as fast as it can with no regard for the state of the other processes.
\item A process can be run on multiple threads at the same time, even if those threads are running on a single CPU.
\item The `multiprocessing` module can allocate additional memory to be used by processes, as required.  This is useful because processes are not restricted by their memory limits like threads are.
\end{itemize}

However, threading has the following advantages:
\begin{itemize}
\item It works well with processes running on single CPUs, which is common nowadays.
\item It is simpler to develop with because there are fewer layers to deal with.
\item It can run cooperatively (ie without locking and blocking), which is useful in many situations.
\item Thread scheduling policies can be more optimized for specific hardware configurations.
\end{itemize}

Which one is better really depends on the specific situation you're dealing with -- it's generally better to avoid having to make this choice in the first place.  The `multiprocessing` module introduces some complexities that make it more difficult to write simple code, but it has lots of advantages for developing parallel code in a wide range of situations.

In some cases, threading might work better.  In others it might be easier and more efficient to write asynchronous code and

instruction:
Provide a Java solution to the following problem.

Given an integer n, return true if it is a power of three. Otherwise, return false.
An integer n is a power of three, if there exists an integer x such that n == 3^x.

Example 1:
In: n = 27
Out: true
Explanation: 27 = 3^3

Example 2:
In: n = 0
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3^x = 0.

Example 3:
In: n = -1
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3x = (-1).
 
Constraints:
-231 <= n <= 231 - 1
Follow up: Could you solve it without loops/recursion?

Constraints:

Follow up: Could you solve it without loops/recursion?

def power_of_3?(n):
   if n < 0 || n <= 0:
     return False

      if n == 3 ** ((3 * n) % 3) :
         return True

# Iteration 2: Iterative Solution with if statement
def power_of_3?(n):

     return False
   # if n cannot be a power of three
   elsif n % 3 != 0:

   # if n is a power of three

# iteration 3: Iterative Solution with If/Else statement
def power_of_3?(n):

# iteration 4: recursive solution using the number to a power
# 3 ** n = n ** 3 ** 3
# solution for a power of 3:
# if n is a power of 3, return true.
#
def power_of_3?(n):
   return 3 ** n % 3 == 0


### Iteration 5: Combination with recursion

# if n is a power of 3, return true
#
def power_of_3?(n):
   return n % 3 == 0 or power_of_3?(n // 3)

instruction:
You are given a programming problem and its implementation. Analyze the problem and implementation and explain the algorithm and approach used to solve the problem.

Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId is the primary key column for this table.
This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;
output_1:
FirstName  LastName   City    State
John   Smith   Miami   FL
Jane   Doe     NULL    NULL

Algorithm:
The algorithm used to solve this problem is a left join operation on the Person and Address tables. The left join operation allows us to combine the two tables and retrieve all the data from the Person table, even if there is no corresponding data in the Address table. This allows us to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table, and report null if a personId is not present in the Address table.

The given article should be checked for any scientific errors and corrected if necessary.

Zinc is an essential mineral that is required for good health. It is involved in many biochemical processes in the body and is necessary for the proper functioning of the immune system. Excess zink is not harmful as it is excreted in the urine.
output_1: Zinc is an essential mineral that is required for good health. It is involved in many biochemical processes in the body and is necessary for the proper functioning of the immune system. Excess zinc is not harmful as it is excreted in the urine.
output_2:
The given article should be checked for any scientific errors and corrected if necessary.

Zinc is an essential mineral that is required for good health. It is involved in many biochemical processes in the body and is necessary for the proper functioning of the immune system. Excess zink is not harmful as it is excreted in the urine. Deficiency of zinc can lead to many problems, including poor growth and immune deficiency. Therefore, it is crucial that the ideal amount of zinc is consumed daily to prevent deficiency.

Foods high in zinc include oysters, beef, pork, poultry, and fortified cereals. Zinc supplements are also available in various forms, such as pills, capsules, syrups, and creams. The recommended daily intake (RDI) of zinc is 11mg for men and 8mg for women. People at risk of zinc deficiency should aim to consume 15-25mg/day of zinc to maintain good health.

Regular intake of zinc can help prevent and treat several health problems, including anemia, diabetes, kidney disease, and malnutrition. In pregnancy, low zinc levels can harm the foetus, so it is necessary to consume adequate zinc throughout pregnancy. Zinc supplements can help prevent preterm births and birth defects. Additionally, zinc plays a crucial role in wound healing and tissue growth, making it essential in various procedures, such as liver transplantation, stem cell transplantation, and tissue engineering.

However, it is essential to consume zinc in moderation to avoid toxicity. Zincdoses in excess of 100mg have been reported to cause symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and diarrhoea. Long-term zinc intake of more than 100mg can cause copper deficiency and lead to various health problems, so it is recommended to consult a healthcare professional before consuming any supplements.

In conclusion, zinc is essential for good health, and regualr intake is recommended. However, it is essential to consume zinc in moderation as excessive intake can cause toxicity. Consult a healthcare proffessional before consuming any supplements.

Further information: Zinc#Biological_function and Zinc#Deficiency_and_toxicity

## External links

* "Zinc". Drug Information Portal. U.S. National Library of Medicine.

instruction:
Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.

Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.
output_1: Mathematics and art have a long history of being intertwined, with mathematical principles having been used in the visual arts since the 4th century BC. This article looks at the use of mathematics in the visual arts, such as painting, sculpture, and architecture, as well as textile arts such as quilting, knitting, and weaving. Examples of this can be found in the works of Polykleitos, Luca Pacioli, Piero della Francesca, Albrecht Dürer, M. C. Escher, and Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian. Islamic art also contains many symmetrical forms, such as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and muqarnas vaulting.

instruction:
Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.

The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output_1: The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, is a global campaign which seeks to ensure that international trading practices are just, sustainable, and equitable. The movement works to build a world in which producers and consumers work together to ensure that all workers receive fair wages and are provided with safe working conditions. It strives to ensure that the environment is protected through sustainable and responsible production methods. The movement also seeks to ensure that producers in developing countries are able to access international markets and earn a living wage. The principles of fair trade have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right. Fair trade provides a solution to many of the issues surrounding global trade, including exploitation, poverty, and inequality. It seeks to empower producers and consumers to create a more equitable and just global economy.
output_2:
Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.

The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.


During the late 1990s, with increasing pressure for corporate responsibility, fair trade became a significant marketing tool. The World Fair Trade Organization reports that since 1993, there has been a fourfold increase in fair trade sales. Fair trade markets grew from US $500 million in 1994 to US $3600 million in 2005. The largest markets are in the European Union, with the United Kingdom leading in the development of fair trade markets. Fair trade has been embraced by the mass consumer market, and retailers with a conscious consumer profile are increasingly offering fair trade products. The Fair Trade Federation of the United States, of which the World Fair Trade Organization is now just one member, has about 30 member organizations, all of which market fair trade products. These products cover everything from coffee to toys, clothing to jewelry, and even services like financial products and carbon offsetting.

Many companies have developed fair trade standards that guarantee minimum prices for producers, while ensuring a fair wage and respecting local cultures and traditions. In doing so, these firms are seeking to promote sustainable development and to reduce poverty. The fair trade movement has taken a more active role in promoting socially responsible investment by developing standards for this. Fair trade activists have begun lobbying for the creation of a "fair trade fund" which would use money from government and from consumers. The Fair Trade Fund would invest in areas where Fair Trade is practiced, helping to build bridges between developed and developing countries, and providing necessary funding for production of commodities that follow fair trade standards.

The Fair Trade movement has had some successes in the promotion of workers' rights, particularly through labor-management organizations of independent coffee farmers in the Third World, and the development of fair trade standards in various fields. These efforts have led to improvements in wages and labor conditions for workers in the production of commodities that are marked as fair trade. Indeed, advocates of fair trade point out that the movement promotes sustainable development because by paying premium prices to producers, it helps to stimulate the developing economies of third world countries.




However, fair trade's success may be limited, and activists debate the effectiveness of existing fair trade initiatives and whether the movement's focus on certification can adequately provide protection for workers' rights. Critics also point out that existing fair trade initiatives, as well as other social responsibility programs, may result in corporate social responsibility being used as a way to legitimize economic practices that continue to exploit workers and the environment.



Fair trade's supporters argue that by setting in motion a broader social and economic transformation, the Fair Trade movement can promote lasting change in Third World economies and help to combat poverty, while promoting global justice. Fair trade's opponents, on the other hand, argue that it is impossible to eliminate poverty and exploitation simply by trying to improve worker wages and conditions.




There are no easy answers to these complex questions, but fair trade activists continue to work towards a more just global economic system, balancing production with people's needs, environmental sustainability, and an ethical approach to consumption.



## External links

* "Fair Trade Organizations". The Fair Trade Federation. Archived from the original on 10 April 2017.
* World Fair Trade Organization

Dentistry, also known as dental medicine and oral medicine, is the branch of medicine focused on the teeth, gums, and mouth. It consists of the study, diagnosis, prevention, management, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the mouth, most commonly focused on dentition (the development and arrangement of teeth) as well as the oral mucosa. Dentistry may also encompass other aspects of the craniofacial complex including the temporomandibular joint. The practitioner is called a dentist.
Translate to French:
output_1: Dentisterie, également connue sous le nom de médecine dentaire et médecine bucco-dentaire, est la branche de la médecine axée sur les dents, les gencives et la bouche. Il consiste à étudier, diagnostiquer, prévenir, gérer et traiter les maladies, les troubles et les conditions de la bouche, le plus souvent axés sur la dentition (le développement et l'agencement des dents) ainsi que sur la muqueuse buccale. La dentisterie peut également englober d'autres aspects du complexe crânio-facial, y compris l'articulation temporo-mandibulaire. Le praticien s'appelle un dentiste.

instruction:
Please answer the following question based on the information provided in the article.

Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social science. Development studies is offered as a specialized master's degree in a number of reputed universities around the world. It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated.  Students of development studies often choose careers in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.
What are some popular careers for students of development studies?
output_1: Popular careers for students of development studies include working in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.

It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated. Comment: I'm surprised by two things in the article: 1) Why would someone need a master degree in the study of development studies to work in the United Nations, World Bank, NGO's, media, journalism, and private sector consultancy firms? 2) Why would someone need a master degree in the study of development studies to work in corporate social responsibility (CSR)?

Comment: @SidZ. The article does not list the qualifications required for jobs in these fields. For instance, a degree in international relations can prepare someone for work at the United Nations, but not necessarily a master's degree in development studies. As far as consultancy firms are concerned, it can potentially be viewed as an advantage, but it surely isn't a requirement. Some people hold PhDs in development studies and even those don't necessarily prepare them for specific jobs in the sector. So, the question is relevant and needs an answer.

Comment: @SidZ. For clarification, I think you misunderstood what I meant by "develop your own answer" in my original comment. The intended purpose was for anyone with a background in development studies to share their experiences and knowledge related to some practical careers they've observed or are involved in. I'm not looking for a comprehensive list of jobs that are available or the minimum requirements for them. Instead, I'm looking for individuals to share more first-hand information.

Answer: \strong{International development consultancy and diplomacy}

International development consultancy firms (like MSA, Chemonics, and DRC) provide professional services, mainly to developing countries, in areas like agriculture, health, education, governance, and others.  They provide technical expertise (for example, agricultural extension) to public institutions, civil society organizations, and private businesses.

In this field, development studies have several advantages. They are a good preparation for working in the field of international cooperation, aid, and diplomacy in non-governmental organizations (NGOs) or working for intergovernmental organizations, like IDB (Inter-American Development Bank), or the World Bank.

These jobs require a solid knowledge of theories of international development, poverty, inequality, historical context, economic theories, and international relations. A master degree program in Development Studies is an excellent way to develop this knowledge.

Students with a degree can work in different areas, depending on their preferences. They can work on specific projects, for example, with international organizations like the World Bank or the United Nations, or work with national and local governments promoting policies that promote growth and development while reducing poverty.

A master degree in development studies not only gives you a foundation of international institutions, cultural sociology, economics, and social sciences but also equips you with a critical and analytical lens to understand various nuances of international development issues in developing countries.

In international diplomacy, students can use their degree to work as an analyst or researcher for embassies or international organizations on issues related to economic or social policy, trade, and foreign investment policies, health issues, education and training programs, etc.

A master degree in Development Studies prepares students for various careers such as teaching at colleges, universities, or other institutes of higher education in various subjects related to development studies or humanities. They can also choose to work in non-profit organizations, government agencies, and other public service institutions which are focused on promoting research, knowledge, information flow, public policy and advocating for human development.

\strong{Research and Academic Careers}
While teaching positions in universities and institutions are also available for development studies graduates, these opportunities are often limited. The main careers for Development Studies graduates are in research, analysis, publications and working for research institutes.

Opportunities

instruction:

Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
output_1:
Course Syllabus

1. Introduction to Programming: This chapter will cover the basics of programming, including the fundamentals of programming syntax and logic.

2. Variables and Data Types: This chapter will cover the different types of variables and data types available in Python and how to use them.

3. Using Functions in Python: This chapter will cover how to use functions and modules in Python, as well as how to create and use user-defined functions.

4. Control Flow and Iteration: This chapter will cover the concepts of control flow and iteration, such as if statements, for loops, and while loops.

5. Working with Files in Python: This chapter will cover how to read, write, and manipulate files in Python.

6. Object-Oriented Programming: This chapter will cover the basics of object-oriented programming, including classes and objects.

7. Debugging and Error Handling: This chapter will cover how to debug and handle errors in Python.

8. Working with Modules and Libraries: This chapter will cover how to use modules and libraries in Python, as well as how to create custom modules.

9. Working with Databases: This chapter will cover how to access and use databases in Python.

10. Web Programming with Python: This chapter will cover how to use Python to create web applications.

11. Final Project: This chapter will cover the final project, which will involve creating a complete Python application.

### Career Outlook

According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, employment of web developers is expected to grow by 15% from 2014-2024, a rate faster than the average for all occupations. Web developers' wages in 2014, ranging from $50,000 to $75,000 annually, are projected to increase over time. Job prospects should be best for individuals with a bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field together with hands-on experience with coding techniques. The job outlook for computer systems analysts is positive: employment is projected to grow by 15% from 2014-2024. In 2018, the median annual salary for web developers was $69,470. Do you think it is possible to create a better learning experience for the student that is free. If so, tell us more about what a “better learning experience” means to you.

Yes. The best learning experiences are ones that are accessible for most citizens, that use new technologies to help people learn as efficiently as possible, and that encourage active participation by students. There are many opportunities to improve the educational experience and free it from traditional institutional structures. One example could come in the form of distributed learning networks that bring together diverse people (students, professors, experts in industry, etc.) from all over the world to collaborate and learn online. The platform of blockchain technology could provide the technical infrastructure for sharing knowledge and creating trust among these diverse actors while maintaining the anonymity of participants.

Do you think it is possible to create a new and better degree model for universities that allows degrees to be earned without attending the university. If so, what would you change or improve?

Yes. The best model would involve the use of blockchain technologies to maintain a decentralized database of learning achievements that can be verified and shared online. Using blockchain could help eliminate barriers to access by providing students with flexible, online learning environments. It could also improve the credentialing process because verified and distributed records of learning achievements would be available instantly and can be used for job applications or to start-up their own businesses.

Do you think that there needs to be a shift towards learning models and/or degree programs that put the learner at the center of everything? If so, what would this new model look like and what is the most important change in how people learn?

Yes. The current educational systems should shift their focus towards providing learners with hands-on experience, access to diverse educational materials, and flexible online learning programs that are tailored to individual learners' needs. To achieve this shift, we need to rethink not only the infrastructure of learning but also the processes of teaching and assessment. The most important change lies in empowering students to take ownership of their learning and provide them with the tools to master the skills they need to succeed in today’s rapidly changing job market.

What do you think is the most important change or improvement that could be made to the global educational system? Why?

In my view, the most important change that needs to be made to the global educational system is to provide all people - women, adults, and refugees - with access to education. The global education system should be able to provide these individuals with educational opportunities regardless of their socioeconomic status, gender, and access to traditional educational facilities. This would require a strong commitment to equitable distribution of educational opportunities, policies that recognize the right of access to education, and the ability to bridge the gap between formal education and practical skills.

What do you think has contributed to success (either personal or professional) in your life or in your work or field and what factors could be considered when creating an educational program that could lead to success in your own field?

Success, whether personal or professional, requires an ongoing effort of learning and practicing your skills - constantly seeking and developing new knowledge and skills. This requires a clear commitment to your studies, self-discipline, and the ability to maintain focus in the face of multiple distractions or opportunities. Educational programs that could lead to success in my field (blockchain) could be designed by seeking expertise in different industries and from leading financial institutions.

Any other thoughts, comments, questions, or insights you want to share?

I want to point out that the educational system needs to work to break down the barriers of access, diversity, and inclusion to ensure that all people, regardless of their background, have equal access to education. The adoption of technological solutions, such as blockchain, can facilitate the emergence of new approaches to education, enabling access and creating new models of learning tailored to the 21st century. Additionally, educators are critical parts of this process and should be given opportunities to develop new skills and to adopt new pedagogical approaches that can support the future generation of learners.

Careers in this field may include:

- Graphic Designer: designing graphics for a variety of visual products for magazines, books, product packaging, advertisements, and websites.

Advertising

Careers in advertising may involve creating ads that help to promote a specific product or organization. Professionals working in this field may be responsible for strategizing and conceptualizing different campaigns to help raise awareness of a company or product.

Careers in this field may include: - Advertising Agency: Develop strategies, implement plans, and execute programs for the success of the clients and their programs. - Copywriter: responsible for creating the written copy for adverts and promotions. - Art Director: responsible for the creative look and style of designs.

Animation

Models create awareness of a fashion brand or designer by using their body as a piece of art to display garments.

Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.

Day 2: Take a day trip to the beautiful Ourika Valley, explore traditional Berber villages, and go for a hike in the Atlas Mountains. 

Day 3: Spend the day in the port city of Essaouira, explore the colorful medina, visit the port, and enjoy the beach. 

Day 4: Visit the city of Fes, take a guided tour of the Medina and the largest Mosque in Morocco, and enjoy the local cuisine. 

Day 5: Take a day trip to the impressive Roman ruins of Volubilis, explore the city of Meknes, and shop for souvenirs. 

Day 6: Explore the city of Rabat, visit the mausoleum of Muhammad V, take a walk along the beach, and enjoy the local cuisine. 

Day 7: Head to the beautiful city of Chefchaouen, explore the maze of streets, and shop for souvenirs. 

Day 8: Take a day trip to the city of Tangier, explore the old medina, enjoy the beach, and sample the local cuisine. 

Day 9: Depart Morocco.
